Section Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL INFORMATION
Subsubsection Text: In this offering memorandum, we present certain historical financial data of the Issuer and the AMC business. This offering memorandum contains the audited consolidated financial statements of the Issuer for the years ended December 31, 2023, 2022 and 2021. These financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States (“GAAP”). This offering memorandum also contains the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business. The AMC business includes historically a product group of Micro Focus International Limited (“Micro Focus”) and, beginning February 1, 2023, the OpenText Connectivity business (“OT Connectivity”), a product group of OpenText. OpenText acquired all of the issued and to be issued share capital of Micro Focus on January 31, 2023 (the “MF Acquisition”). The AMC business has historically operated as part of Micro Focus or, following acquisition thereof, OpenText and not as a standalone company. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business included elsewhere in this offering memorandum are presented on a “carve-out” basis from (i) Micro Focus’s accounting records for the period from January 1, 2022 to January 31, 2023 and (ii) OpenText’s accounting records for the period from and after February 1, 2023, using the historical results of operations, cash flows, assets and liabilities of the AMC business. For the period from January 1, 2022 to January 31, 2023, the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business exclude OT Connectivity. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business include allocations of corporate expenses and shared expenses from Micro Focus for the period from January 1, 2022 to January 31, 2023 (prior to the MF Acquisition) and OpenText for the period from and after February 1, 2023 (following the MF Acquisition). These allocations reflect significant assumptions and the combined financial statements may not fully reflect what the AMC business’s financial position, results of operations or cash flows would have been had it been a standalone company during the periods presented. As a result, the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business included elsewhere in this offering memorandum are not necessarily indicative of the AMC business’s future results of operations, financial position or cash flows. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business were prepared in accordance with GAAP. Except as expressly noted, OpenText has not prepared or reviewed any information about the AMC business or the combined business for this offering memorandum or confirmed the accuracy of the information included in this offering memorandum. Additionally, the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business that are included in this offering memorandum have not been separately filed with, or furnished to, the SEC by OpenText.

Section Title: NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES
Subsubsection Text: We have included certain financial measures that are not based on GAAP in this offering memorandum, including Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue, Non-GAAP Cost of Revenue, Non-GAAP Gross Profit, EBITDA, Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA Margin, Free Cash Flow and Free Cash Flow Conversion with respect to the Issuer and the AMC business, as applicable (collectively, the “Non-GAAP Metrics”). We believe that these measures are useful financial metrics to assess our operating ----- performance from period to period by excluding certain items that we believe are not representative of our core business. We believe that they provide investors with a useful tool for assessing the comparability between periods of our ability to generate cash from operations sufficient to pay taxes, to service debt and to undertake capital expenditures. We use these measures for business planning purposes and in measuring our performance relative to that of our competitors. Certain of our Non-GAAP Metrics have been calculated utilizing accounting principles not consistent with GAAP, including recognizing revenue on an Annual Recurring Revenue (“ARR”) basis rather than in accordance with Accounting Standards Codification (“ASC”) Update No. 2014-09, Revenue from Contracts with Customers (“ASC 606”). A primary difference between ARR and ASC 606 is the accounting for license revenue in our subscription or term license arrangements, which is annualized and recognized over the contract term under our ARR method, while recognized at a point in time, generally at the inception of the contract term, under ASC 606. Our use of the Non-GAAP Metrics varies from others in our industry. Our Non-GAAP Metrics should not be considered as alternatives to net income (loss), revenue or other measures of performance derived in accordance with GAAP as measures of operating performance or operating cash flows or as measures of liquidity. Our Non-GAAP Metrics have important limitations as analytical tools and you should not consider them in isolation or as substitutes for analysis of our results as reported under GAAP. Some of these limitations are: - such measures do not reflect our cash expenditures, or future requirements for capital expenditures or contractual commitments; - such measures do not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for, our working capital needs; - such measures do not reflect the significant interest expense, or the cash requirements necessary to service interest payments, on our debts; - although depreciation and amortization are non-cash charges, the assets being depreciated and amortized will often have to be replaced in the future, and these measures do not reflect any cash requirements for such replacements; - non-cash compensation, including in connection with certain acquisitions, is and will remain an element of our overall long-term incentive compensation package, although we exclude it as an expense when evaluating our ongoing operating performance for a particular period; - such measures do not reflect the impact of certain cash charges resulting from matters we consider not to be indicative of our ongoing operations; - such measures reflect estimated cost savings and synergies that may not be achieved; and - other companies in our industry may calculate these measures differently than we do, limiting their usefulness as comparative measures. In this offering memorandum, we disclose the Non-GAAP Metrics with respect to the Issuer and the AMC business on a standalone and pro forma basis, as applicable. Some of the Non-GAAP Metrics with respect to the AMC business were prepared by us based on certain financial information obtained through our financial diligence process. The methodology for preparing such financial information is different than the methodology used by OpenText to prepare the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business (including with respect to the allocation of shared costs) and such Non-GAAP Metrics should therefore not be viewed as substitutes for the AMC business’s results as reported under GAAP. OpenText neither prepared nor reviewed these Non-GAAP Metrics, and OpenText does not utilize any such Non-GAAP Metrics in its own reporting with respect to the AMC business. We have not yet closed the AMC Acquisition, and the Non-GAAP Metrics with respect to the AMC business are therefore subject to certain adjustments and changes after we close the AMC Acquisition and integrate the AMC business into our own business. ----- For a more detailed discussion and reconciliations of our Non-GAAP Metrics to their most directly comparable GAAP measures, see “Summary––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information.” The financial information included in this offering memorandum is not intended to comply with the requirements of Regulation S-X under the Securities Act and the rules and regulations of the SEC promulgated thereunder, in particular with respect to (a) the presentation of certain non-GAAP financial measures (as described above) and (b) the presentation of the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial information in the section entitled “Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information.” In addition, in “Summary––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information,” the “Pro Forma” information presented under the “Pro Forma” column for the year ended December 31, 2023 reflects certain adjustments as described under “Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information” that were not applied to the “Pro Forma” information presented under the “Historical” columns for the years ended December 31, 2023, 2022 and 2021, including Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA Margin and certain other Non-GAAP Metrics. These metrics are therefore not fully comparable. Furthermore, the Non-GAAP Metrics that include the AMC business for the year ended December 31, 2022 do not include the same pro forma adjustments reflected in the pro forma financial information for the year ended December 31, 2023 and as set forth in “Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information” and represent a management combined presentation whereby the Non-GAAP Metrics of the AMC business for the year ended December 31, 2022 were added together with the Non-GAAP Metrics of Rocket for the same year, with certain adjustments as described in “Summary––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information.”

Section Title: FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: This offering memorandum contains “forward-looking statements” within the meaning of securities laws. You should not place undue reliance on these statements. Forward-looking statements include information concerning our liquidity and our possible or assumed future results of operations, including descriptions of our business strategies. These statements often include words such as “believe,” “expect,” “anticipate,” “intend,” “plan,” “estimate,” “seek,” “will,” “may” or similar expressions. These statements are based on certain assumptions that we have made in light of our experience in the industry as well as our perceptions of historical trends, current conditions, expected future developments and other factors we believe are appropriate in these circumstances. As you read and consider this offering memorandum, you should understand that these statements are not guarantees of performance or results. They involve risks, uncertainties and assumptions. Many factors could affect our actual financial results and could cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed in the forward-looking statements. Some important factors include: - the potential impact of, and any potential developments related to, the AMC Acquisition; - potential loss of significant revenue from our long-term partnership with IBM; - failure by our customers to renew their contracts with us; - our inability to attract new customers or convert single-product customers into multi-product customers in a cost-effective manner; - failure to accurately predict, prepare for and respond to rapidly evolving technological and market developments, including the use of artificial intelligence (“AI”) and other machine learning technologies; - disruption, discovery of errors in or risks related to our software solutions; - cyber-attacks on our networks and actual or perceived security vulnerabilities in our products; - lack of availability, integrity and security of information technology (“IT”) systems that our business and products depend on; ----- - failure to attract, train and retain highly qualified employees and other key personnel; - failure to access or rely on third-party products; - risks associated with the use of open source software; - our significant competition; - our ability to continue to invest in adequate research and development resources; - damage to our reputation; - our ability to meet growth and productivity objectives; - our use of estimates and assumptions used to determine the size of our target market; - failure to appropriately price our products and services; - our indirect distribution channels; - lack of compatibility between our products and the ever-changing operating and database environments and failure to support older versions of our products and services; - global economic, political and market conditions; - third party claims that our software products or services infringe their intellectual property rights; - failure by our patents, licenses or other intellectual property rights to protect our technologies; - our ability to achieve successful business combinations, including the AMC Acquisition; - our ability to timely realize all of the anticipated benefits of the AMC Acquisition; - the significant one-time integration costs we will incur in connection with the AMC Acquisition; - certain risks if the notes are issued prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition and proceeds are deposited into the Escrow Account; - our ability to manage the expanded operations following the AMC Acquisition; and - other risks referenced in “Risk Factors” in this offering memorandum. In light of these risks, uncertainties and assumptions, the forward-looking statements contained in this offering memorandum might not prove to be accurate and you should not place undue reliance upon them. All forward-looking statements attributable to us or persons acting on our behalf are expressly qualified in their entirety by the foregoing cautionary statements. All such statements speak only as of the date made, and we undertake no obligation to update or revise publicly any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. New risk factors and uncertainties may emerge from time to time, and it is not possible for management to predict all risk factors and uncertainties.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: Rocket is a leading global enterprise software provider with a broad portfolio of products that help corporations, government agencies, and other organizations run their mission-critical IT operations. We enable small and large enterprises in many industries to maximize their data, systems and infrastructure to deliver critical services that power our modern world. Our software runs, optimizes and protects our customers’ applications, servers and databases, and integrates these core platforms with the rest of the enterprise, while providing a full-stack of modernization solutions. Our products enable customers to carry out their most mission-critical business functions, such as processing payment transactions at global financial institutions and maintaining healthcare records at hospitals and insurance companies. Since our founding over 30 years ago, we have cultivated a customer-centric culture with strategic investments in research and development (“R&D”) that provide a wide range of solutions to meet customers’ evolving needs. We have evolved from solely maintaining legacy infrastructure to facilitating modernization journeys to connect mainframe to the hybrid cloud environment. We have accomplished this evolution through substantial R&D efforts, highlighted by over $500 million in investments into R&D since 2020, as well as multiple acquisitions that have expanded our modernization offering. Given our focus on supporting our customers’ mission-critical business functions, our products address deeply embedded technologies that sit at the core of enterprise IT infrastructure. These systems have evolved over multiple decades and, particularly for our largest customers, represent billions of dollars of cumulative custom application development and IT infrastructure investment. As enterprises look to the future, hybrid remains vital to enabling the deployment of cloud environments as it incorporates client server computing, cloud-based platforms, and modern connectivity and portability. We seek to enable our customers to experience the best of both the cloud and the mainframe, putting relevant workloads in the cloud while leveraging the mainframe for its best features – security, reliability, and governance. Our strategy is to modernize without disruption, meeting customers where they are in their modernization journey. By utilizing our product portfolio, customers can modernize effectively, even incrementally, integrating new technologies while preserving and leveraging the robust foundation already in place for a seamless technological evolution. We believe this approach dramatically lowers risk and improves success rates of IT system modernization projects. As the pace of digital transformation continues to accelerate, we believe our customers will increasingly look to us to extract greater value from existing IT systems and applications through innovation, integration, optimization and modernization. Today, Rocket is organized into three main business units focused on Infrastructure Modernization, Data Modernization and Application Modernization. While each business unit has its own technical requirements and products, we go to market using a holistic approach to solving our customers’ problems, utilizing solutions across our business units to help drive operating efficiencies among overlapping buying centers to best position us to drive future growth. These business units are as follows: _Infrastructure Modernization: Our Infrastructure Modernization business unit represents approximately_ 55% of our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It comprises software solutions built for integrating and optimizing mainframe workloads, mitigating security and compliance risks and optimizing storage. Organizations can leverage our range of solutions to support mainframe security and ----- compliance in the face of new threats and deliver optimized mainframe performance management and interoperability. The mainframe continues to be an integral part of modern-day IT infrastructure and provides a reliable architecture for high-volume data processing and transactions. Mainframes provide a level of five 9s of availability (99.999%), which is several orders of magnitude higher than alternative distributed servers, making mainframes the optimal platform for mission-critical processes. Additionally, mainframes are uniquely engineered to process millions of input and output calculations per second, which is a key difference from distributed servers that are designed to be more general purpose, limiting their ability to perform a specialized task extremely well. Consequently, mainframes provide a range of advantages over distributed systems that are likely to persist, and we believe organizations in regulated and data intensive industries will continue to rely on mainframe systems to process high-volume, missioncritical activity at the core of their IT infrastructures. _Data Modernization: Our Data Modernization business unit represents approximately 18% of our_ standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It provides software solutions to connect mission-critical data residing on the mainframe and distributed systems to advanced applications and compute workloads running on private and public cloud environments. As organizations increasingly adopt a hybrid cloud infrastructure approach to operations, effectively navigating the complexities of data governance and compliance while maximizing data utilization is critical. Our solutions address this challenge by eliminating data siloes to enhance decision-making and customer experience while maintaining strong data governance, security, scalability and dynamic availability. For example, one of our key products, Mobius, enables customers to integrate seamlessly with third-party repositories, facilitating secure and efficient data movement between modern and legacy systems. Our track record of successfully integrating acquisitions within this business unit highlights our commitment to providing an end-to-end offering that reframes customer engagement strategies and paves the way for future growth. _Application Modernization: Our Application Modernization business unit represents the remaining 27% of_ our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It is comprised of a portfolio of solutions aimed at improving application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating modern workflows for legacy applications. While Application Modernization covers both distributed offmainframe platforms and mainframe environments, many of the most important back-end applications for large enterprises still reside on the mainframe and have yet to be modernized. With key offerings including database management, DevOps, and low-code application development platforms, we enable organizations to efficiently deliver reliable, scalable and secure applications to support their core business needs. One of our key innovations has been to enable enterprise adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern development practices even for legacy systems. Across these three business units, we serve over 12,500 end-user customers, pro forma for the AMC Acquisition. Our customer base spans every major industry vertical and includes some of the largest companies in the world, including 43 of the Fortune 50, as of 2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition). Our customer base is highly diversified with the top ten Rocket-led customers representing just 14% of revenue in the year ended December 31, 2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition). In addition to these deeply embedded and long-term customer relationships, we have also cultivated a number of partnerships that are critical to our business. Our largest partnership is with IBM. We generate approximately 23% of our revenue through IBM-led sales. Through a series of organic R&D investments, acquisitions, joint development efforts and a strong go-to-market (“GTM”) partnership, we have become one of IBM’s most trusted software partners. This partnership has evolved over 30 years and is driven primarily by our expertise in mainframe and mid-range servers of which IBM is a major manufacturer. Our software enhances and creates efficiencies for IBM’s customers and extends the life of IBM’s core platforms. In partnership with IBM, we develop and support core software offerings in their portfolio, freeing IBM to redirect their R&D spend to other areas. As part of our partnership with IBM, numerous Rocket products are re-branded as IBM products and sold through their global salesforce. While we are committed to remaining a high-quality business partner to IBM and extending the lifetime value of core IBM-led products, we are working to increase the share of Rocket-led sales to further diversify our revenue. Our Rocket-led GTM strategy, whether executed directly or through our channel partners, allows us to provide best-in ----- class support to our customers in managing their mainframe and modernization journey, particularly as they move towards a hybrid cloud environment. We are headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts and maintain a large global footprint with significant operations in North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia and Australia. As of December 31, 2023 we had 2,200 employees (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition) worldwide with a presence in 13 global offices. Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to have approximately 3,000 Rocketeers and 20 global offices. This worldwide coverage provides us with access to economies of scale, lower cost offshore operations, high-growth emerging markets and global support for our increasingly global customer base.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsection Title: Acquisition of Application Modernization and Connectivity
Subsubsection Text: On November 28, 2023, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the AMC business of OpenText, which includes historically a product group of Micro Focus and, beginning February 1, 2023, the OT Connectivity business, a product group of OpenText, for an all-cash purchase price of $2.275 billion, before taxes, fees and other adjustments. For more information, see “––The AMC Acquisition.” The AMC business has been a leader in application modernization for many years with a focus on mainframe replatforming solutions that help with the migration and operation of mainframe workloads to distributed and cloud environments. For the year ended December 31, 2023, the AMC business generated Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue of $504 million and Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA of $307 million. AMC Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue is comprised of (x) for the year ended December 31, 2022, approximately $355 million of ARR, $108 million of perpetual license revenue and $13 million of professional service revenue, and (y) for the year ended December 31, 2023, approximately $364 million of ARR, $121 million of perpetual license revenue and $20 million of professional services revenue. The AMC business operates within five portfolio segments that form a comprehensive suite for mainframe application development, maintenance and modernization: _Enterprise Suite: The AMC business’s Enterprise Suite business unit represents approximately 18% of its_ revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution is the AMC business’s fastest growing product line, providing end-to-end mainframe workload migration tools including migration analysis, test and deployment tools and an enterprise server that emulates the mainframe environment in the cloud. The Enterprise Suite helps organizations move mainframe workloads to run on distributed environments with a significantly lower degree of code change relative to other complex migration options like refactoring. Within the Enterprise Suite, four core tools address different stages of workload migration and application development. The Analyzer, Developer and Enterprise Test Server are focused on delivering diagnostic tools, modern Integrated Development Environments (“IDE”) and virtual test environments. The Enterprise Server provides a multi-platform production environment to replatform IBM z/OS applications. The revenue derived from Enterprise Server is highly recurring in nature and allows for an emulated mainframe on cloud environments with the ability to run mission-critical applications. _COBOL: The AMC business’s Common Business Oriented Language (“COBOL”) business unit represents_ approximately 36% of its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution enables organizations to develop, maintain and deploy COBOL based applications across the enterprise using modern DevOps tools and platforms. COBOL is a legacy programming language that is integral to the majority of mission-critical applications. As most developers lack experience working in COBOL, a modern set of DevOps tools enables enterprises to modernize and update their most important applications. The AMC business’s tools provide an IDE for analyzing and editing COBOL in applications primarily offmainframe, providing developers with visualizations and coding environments similar to modern IDEs. As one indicator of the AMC business’s market position, the AMC business is the only official COBOL compiler available on Cloud Service Providers’ (“CSPs”) marketplaces. _Host Connectivity: The AMC business’s Host Connectivity business unit represents approximately 32% of_ its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution includes mainframe terminal emulators and plugins for application access, process automation and security solutions. Customer use cases include providing flexible access to mission-critical applications running on mainframe environments via modern, distributed systems (desktop, web and mobile) in a secure and compliant manner (i.e. multi factor ----- authentication). The AMC business’s Host Connectivity tools provide a broad number of options that allow for significant customization to deliver strong, auditable and compliant security that meets organizations’ requirements. _Mainframe Application Development Life Cycle Management (“ADLM”): The AMC business’s Mainframe_ ADLM business unit represents approximately 11% of its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution provides mainframe source code change, configuration and management enabling organizations to modernize and integrate mainframes across new technologies and platforms. This results in shorter app delivery cycles, stronger security and increased productivity. Customer use cases include version control functionality to track changes made to source code (i.e. ChangeMan ZMF), change management workflow, release management and automation, automated testing, auditing and reporting. _CORBA: The AMC business’s Common Object Request Broker Architecture (“CORBA”) business unit_ represents approximately 3% of its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution provides middleware for communication across distributed applications. CORBA add-on solutions enable any CORBA application to take advantage of new deployment models, including cloud, containers and virtual environments or to extend and re-use existing CORBA resources without prior knowledge of CORBA technology. These solutions are used in telecommunications for managing network elements and the integration of different vendor equipment, in military and defense for building command and control systems and in finance for trading and risk management systems. The AMC Acquisition represents a highly complementary addition to our product portfolio, with the AMC business expected to further build out a more diverse modernization portfolio that aligns with customer demands and allows us to meet our customers wherever they are on their modernization journey. The AMC Acquisition is expected to achieve key strategic objectives, including: - Expanding the product portfolio with a stronger, more comprehensive modernization offering that is able to meet customers at any stage of their IT modernization journey, whether modernizing in place, migrating select workloads to hybrid environments or replatforming; - Providing a full-stack of products and solutions to enable end-to-end modernization without the disruption of existing workflows and allow customers to derive value from their decades of investment in core applications; - Expanding customer reach through deeper and broader customer engagement across Fortune 2000 accounts for greater retention and cross-selling. A more comprehensive and complete offering solidifies Rocket as the strategic partner of choice to address customer needs, tapping into developer-led decisions and guiding customers through their modernization journey over time, ultimately expanding Rocket’s relevance; - Tapping into CSP budget pools through the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities, augmenting our existing hybrid cloud solutions suite and expanding our footprint with CSPs including Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure as preferred replatforming partners; - Expanding our global reach, with a stronger presence in Europe, Middle East and Africa (“EMEA”), Asia Pacific, and Latin American channels, thus diversifying our revenue sources and redistributing geographic concentrations; and - Combining R&D engines to drive increased innovation, better modernization capabilities and more elegant solutions to further accelerate a shifty to hybrid cloud technology. The AMC business’s additional resources for innovation will foster continuous R&D innovation through the application of emerging technologies like generative artificial intelligence. Acquiring the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs, including Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure, is expected to enable us to tap into new budget pools and augment our existing hybrid cloud solutions suite. Rocket has broken down the boundaries of on-premises and cloud ----- computing so that businesses can connect IT systems and modern applications. The seamless data flow, data integration and continuous enhancements create benefits like streamlined processes, improved efficiencies, and better return on investment so that customers can be more dynamic, secure, and agile in the face of an increasingly complex IT and business environment. Access to the AMC business’s additional software developers will drive increased innovation and development of better solutions to accelerate a shift to a hybrid cloud environment, reinforcing our commitment to our customer-centric R&D efforts. This move is expected to further strengthen our position as the partner of choice for mission-critical IT modernization.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: Our marketing and GTM strategies are driven, first and foremost, to deliver the right solutions to customers, regardless of channel. To that end, our sales and marketing efforts are bifurcated between our Rocket-led products and our IBMled products, each of which have their own strategies. Our Rocket-led products are sold through two primary avenues: (1) direct to customer through our centralized customer success, support and delivery teams and (2) channel partners. - Our direct sales force and marketing investment, which is focused on Rocket-led solutions, is shifting the dialogue from mainframe buying centers to a Chief Information Officer (“CIO”) and Chief Product Officer (“CPO”) strategy covering the expanse of Rocket use cases. We rely on marketing to drive brand awareness, generate leads across our growth product areas and support subscription and maintenance renewals by reinforcing the value delivered by our new releases and product innovation. Through our 30-year operating history and over 50 acquisitions, we have a strong base of customers that we continually look to serve with our growing portfolio of solutions. Our sales force targets both existing customers and new logo opportunities and is comprised of a global set of enterprise sales professionals focused on account relationships. Our enterprise sales professionals are product specialists who focus on selling our solutions with our solutions engineers providing technical guidance to customers throughout the sales process. This team handles new sales as well as up-sells and cross-sells within existing accounts, further driving revenue expansion. Renewals of existing maintenance contracts and subscriptions are handled by our centralized renewal team, who have helped to drive our consistently high renewal rates. - In addition to our direct sales force, our Rocket-led sales organization also leads our strategic alliances. Our 10 strategic channel partner relationships consist of resellers, distributors and systems integrators who embed our solutions in other software applications and help to deliver new solutions to market. Our strong relationships with Independent Software Vendors (“ISVs”) and Managed Service Providers (“MSPs”) enable us to better reach both current and potential customers, and these strong MSP relationships also support customers using MSPs to manage their mainframe. For our IBM-led products, we have a dedicated sales enablement team across the IBM Original Equipment Manufacturer (“OEM”) product segments, all backed by a 30-year longstanding partnership driving us and IBM to partner on opportunities and deployments. These joint Rocket-IBM sales and marketing initiatives allow us to drive demand, refine messaging, enable sales and strengthen win rates for our IBM-led products, which continue to have strong retention rates supported by the strength of our partnership with IBM. In addition to benefits that we realize from the partnership, IBM also leverages us to support the broader mainframe industry and expand value delivered from incumbent involvement. Ultimately, our powerful GTM strategy is bolstered by a centralized customer success and support effort with global coverage, a dedicated team focused on renewals and driving upsell and cross-sell opportunities across the installed base, numerous strategic alliances that help market and distribute our solutions and a robust partnership with IBM. The combination of these factors forms our strong customer success engine and continues to help us drive strong retention rates. We have further built our business to serve the expanding needs of our customers and address growing budget pools that are focused on digital transformation. We’ve transitioned from a focus on providing solutions to the head of infrastructure to addressing a head of applications or a Chief Data Officer who is focused on driving revenue generation of their business. Whether it is the CIO or the Chief Data Officer, we have solutions that address their ----- mission-critical challenges and our GTM approach ensures that we serve the different needs of our expanded buyer set. The combined forces of Rocket and the AMC business are expected to create a broader product offering that serves the entire modernization continuum, all in a single partner. As one example of how the AMC Acquisition will help broaden our product offering and modernization capabilities, we expect the AMC business to provide us with additional GTM channels to tap into CSP budget pools given the AMC business’s strength in replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs. We believe this will further elevate Rocket’s status with MSPs, CSPs and other key ecosystem participants, further strengthening and differentiating our GTM strategy.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: _Deep and Embedded Portfolio of Solutions Meets Customer Needs Across Environments_ Since our founding, we have focused strategically on innovation to develop and enhance our software solutions to consistently meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our portfolio of solutions represents a full-stack of purpose-built products tailored to various end markets. Within each of these environments, we address customer pain points at every layer of their IT system. This ranges from the core IT infrastructure (i.e. software tooling for the mainframe itself or an embedded database) to newly developed applications that are open source in nature and run in the cloud but need to integrate with the more traditional components of a customer’s IT system. In delivering this comprehensive portfolio of products, we focus on opportunities categorized within our three synergistic business lines: Infrastructure Modernization, Data Modernization and Application Modernization. We expect the AMC Acquisition to bring a suite of tools with a focus on mainframe modernization and replatforming that help with the migration of critical mainframe workloads to distributed and cloud environments. The AMC Acquisition is expected to broaden our existing product portfolio with complementary modernization solutions and an increased focus on enabling migration to the cloud. Illustrative use cases that enable customers throughout their modernization journey include but are not limited to: - Creating modern platforms and tools that are faster, cheaper and lower risk than replacing incumbent systems to modernize; - Providing a toolset for mainframe replatforming and management of critical mainframe migration workloads; - Providing the tools for modern, compliant, and agile developer experiences; - Managing and operating core IT infrastructure more efficiently without forcing disruptive re-platforming; - Connecting legacy systems with cloud infrastructure; and - Managing accelerating data growth and provide real-time access for AI, machine learning (“ML”), data and analytics. ----- |Col1|Col2| |---|---| ----- ----- ----- PF RR Cash EBITDA Margin Rocket $438 $307 **$774** 2023 2021 59% $29 ----- and Legal Officers, but also two new Business Unit Presidents. These strategic new hires bring with them strong connections with IBM and other key channel partners. We maintain a partnership framework with IBM executives that facilitates alignment with functions within IBM and Rocket and, across the organization, our executives and business unit leaders maintain regular dialogue with their IBM counterparts. Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to hire Stuart McGill, the current Chief Revenue Officer of the AMC business, who has been with the company since 1984, and Neil Fowler, the current Chief Technology Officer of the AMC business, who has been with the company since 1991. Mr. McGill and Mr. Fowler would bring decades of experience and expertise to our already talented management team. We believe that our success in steadily growing Rocket as a cash-flow generative company has greatly benefitted from these strategic hires, and we anticipate continued success in the future.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: _Embrace Hybrid Cloud to Enable Enterprises to Unlock New Capabilities and Growth Opportunities and Simultaneously Optimize Mission-Critical Systems_ Through our strategy of enabling enterprises to embrace and innovate with hybrid cloud, companies can deploy, execute and manage workloads, applications and data agnostic of their chosen infrastructure in a seamless and transparent manner from mainframe to cloud. This approach allows enterprises to not only maximize the full potential and value of their data stored on mainframe, but also leverage that data to drive decisions and insights from cloudnative capabilities, including AI, ML and advanced analytics. One of our key innovations has been to enable enterprise adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern development practices even for legacy systems and which we expect the AMC Acquisition to further enhance. This will empower our customers as they pursue their modernization journeys, and we are right there with them. Ultimately, this narrative aligns the technology investments made by enterprises with their key business outcomes, providing customers with a complete lifecycle of solutions and letting them focus on business without worrying about the constraints of their current technology architecture. _Focus on R&D and Investment in Product Portfolio_ Since 2020, we have invested $521 million in R&D initiatives. With nearly 1,900 Rocketeer Engineers (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition) and an R&D presence in five continents, our R&D investment is the cornerstone of our ability to innovate, enabling us to better address customer needs, retain existing accounts and attract new business. It also allows us to provide full-stack solutions to our customers, which we believe, in conjunction with our powerful GTM team and strategy, will ultimately drive strong retention rates among our installed bases. Our customer-centric R&D shows our true understanding of the different needs of our customers and buyers who are looking to modernize their infrastructure, reinforcing, and magnifying our commitment to innovation. Additionally, because we’ve scaled the business so significantly through both organic and inorganic growth, we’ve managed to achieve significant scale efficiency in our R&D investments. _Support Full-Stack Modernization and Tap into Multiple Budget Pools_ We provide a full-stack of infrastructure, application, and data modernization solutions, allowing companies to integrate legacy and distributed systems with modern cloud capabilities. This full-stack of IT system modernization solutions allows us to tap into multiple budget pools, including those covered by the CIO, Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications, Chief Information Security Officer, Head of Infrastructure and more. With our suite of products and solutions, we can help companies ensure that their existing infrastructure is able to successfully deliver digital transformation initiatives and provide competitive advantages; deliver new mission-critical applications across hybrid infrastructures; govern and access key data and content to strengthen customer relationships and ensure compliance; and drive key initiatives to secure and protect data across the broader enterprise. This multi-layered approach opens corporate budgets beyond the mainframe and infrastructure-centric buyer and expands our wallet share to larger digital transformation initiatives that we can access through upsell and cross-sell opportunities. ----- _Maintain Our Strong Operational Efficiency and Profitability_ Our focus on operational efficiency and disciplined expense management has helped us to maintain consistently high Adjusted EBITDA margins. This commitment to cost control has enabled our ongoing investments in R&D to further expand our solution footprint. We believe this continued emphasis on cost control results in attractive operating leverage and cash flow generation. _Pursue Accretive Acquisitions to Further Supplement Our Portfolio_ Over our history, we have completed more than 50 acquisitions and developed a track record of successfully integrating acquired companies. Acquisitions have historically been completed at attractive multiples and have allowed us to further enhance our product portfolio. Our multi-prong approach to evaluating potential acquisitions includes identification of (1) Solution Enhancement, (2) Solution Expansion and (3) Synergy Realization, which allows us to be intentional and methodical throughout both the discovery and vetting processes. We focus on opportunities that accelerate the development of important underinvested functionalities, provide cross-selling opportunities, and rationalize costs through scale.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: We view our business as having three distinct addressable markets, each of which is aligned with a specific business unit. While these markets are distinct in nature, there is a common thread in that the environment and underlying technology are deeply embedded and responsible for organizations’ most mission-critical functions. We expect the AMC Acquisition to further build out our product capabilities to address all customer use cases, and we will integrate the AMC business’s products into our existing business units. While investment in legacy systems has been stable, companies are increasing their spend across modernization, integration, hybridization and next-generation data applications. We are positioned to serve as a modernization partner that taps into growing budget pools focused on digital transformation across a suite of buyers with evergreen budget pools including the CIO, Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications and Head of Infrastructure. In aggregate, we view our current total addressable market as $24 billion, which sits within a broader $3.9 trillion digital transformation market. Our three current addressable markets are as follows: - _Mainframe and Hybrid Cloud Software: Our infrastructure modernization products support customers in optimizing their mainframe workloads across a broad spectrum of pathways. Based on third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to mainframe and hybrid cloud software to be approximately $11 billion. Going forward, this market is expected to grow at approximately 4% annually. We believe we have an approximately 4% market share of this addressable market. For most of our customers, the embedded nature of mainframe servers and the speed, size and security requirements of the workloads being run on them make switching away from the mainframe an expensive and difficult process. The importance of mainframe is evidenced by the fact that approximately 70% of the world’s production IT workloads are handled by mainframes. According to IBM, over $8 trillion in payments per year, and over 30 billion transactions per day, are processed by mainframes. Mainframe criticality is driven by the need for reliability, with many applications requiring high availability, and the complexity and vastness of the underlying code makes mainframe integral to operations. There are a range of advantages that mainframe offers over distributed computing including reliability, speed of computing and security. For customers who remain on the mainframe, the increased data requirements and volumes generated by the digitalization of businesses will lead to increasing mainframe workloads. For example, when retail bank account holders check their account or engage in online banking, this activity results in queries to the mainframe creating additional mainframe transaction volume. As retail banks and other institutions increase their product offerings and continue their digital transformation initiatives, the ability to connect and interact with the mainframe will be an important component of most IT deployments. Higher workload volume combined with the ongoing need to operate, optimize, and modernize the mainframe should provide continued growth opportunities within our Infrastructure Modernization business unit. ----- We expect the AMC Acquisition to expand our product offerings in the mainframe and hybrid cloud market with Enterprise Suite, COBOL and Mainframe ADLM, enabling further modernization of mainframe applications and hybrid cloud infrastructure. With the largest companies in the world across every major industry vertical continuing to leverage mainframe technology through hybrid cloud models, we expect that hybrid infrastructure will remain the architecture of choice. By enabling core IT infrastructure to continue living in mainframe environments while leveraging APIs that provide teams and customers with access to cloud solutions and web and mobile applications, businesses are providing a modern experience for employees and end-users, without taking on additional risk. - _Enterprise Content Management (“ECM”): Data modernization solutions enable organizations to capture, build, organize, manage and store enterprise documents and records. Using third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to ECM solutions to be approximately $5 billion. Going forward, this market is forecasted to grow at approximately 6% annually. Enterprises need to securely manage documents and records across their organization and require software that provides tools to capture, build, organize, manage and store documents and records as they flow through business processes. ECM modernization tools for mainframe-based enterprises allow organizations to utilize terabytes of stored data that are typically inaccessible and unutilized. Common applications of ECM systems for our customers involve document generation workloads, which include invoice and statement generation and ticket issuance. More advanced processes include document ingestion, robotic process automation and workflow management. For example, processing a mortgage application is a complex process involving multiple steps and systems, which can be streamlined and automated with an ECM system. ECM solutions are often embedded in core customer facing workflows and are integrated with other core IT systems (enterprise resource planning systems, customer relationship management systems, financial systems, etc.) that leverage other mainframe-stored content. The critical nature and deep integration of ECM workflows should continue to drive future growth within our Data Modernization business unit. - _App Development & Testing: Our application modernization solutions enable organizations to extract data from legacy Unix/Power Systems, modernize the experience for users and enable the usability of large scale non-relational databases. Based on third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to application development and testing to be approximately $8 billion. Going forward, this market is forecasted to grow by approximately 5% annually. Organizations use application modernization products to improve application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating modern workflows for legacy applications in a safe and secure way. Common uses of application modernization products include enabling application development on top of mission-critical non-relational databases, removing complexity from building modern apps on legacy platforms with low- or no-code solutions and supporting agile DevOps methods across multiple legacy coding environments. Continued investment in functionality that supports cloud and containerized app deployments, organizations improving application UI/UX and a shift to low- or no-code development concepts should provide continued growth opportunities within our Application Modernization business unit. The AMC business’s Host Connectivity and CORBA segments offer complementary modernization solutions enabling Rocket to provide a more comprehensive solution to our customers and increase our share in the application and development testing market.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: With approximately $180 billion in assets under management and over 395 investments completed, Bain Capital Private Equity, LP (“Bain Capital”) is one of the world’s leading private multi-asset investment firms and creates a lasting impact for investors, teams, businesses and communities. Founded in 1984, Bain Capital pioneered a consulting-based approach to private equity investing, partnering closely with management teams to offer the insights that challenge conventional thinking, build great businesses and improve operations. Over time, the firm has organically expanded this approach across asset classes including private equity, venture capital, public equity and fixed income. Since its inception, the firm has made primary or add-on investments in more than 1,385 companies. Bain Capital has a proven track record of enhancing companies’ financial strength and strategic positioning in the Technology and Infrastructure Software sectors. Select recent investments as examples of Bain Capital’s activity in ----- the space include: BMC Software, Blue Coat and Nutanix. The investment in Rocket Software, Inc. is contributed by Bain Capital’s 12[th] family of North American private equity fund pools.

Section Title: SUMMARY
Subsubsection Text: _Acquisition Agreement_ On November 28, 2023, we entered into a Purchase Agreement (the “Acquisition Agreement”) with OpenText, pursuant to which OpenText has agreed to divest, directly and indirectly through certain subsidiaries, its AMC business and we have agreed to purchase the same and generally assume certain liabilities related to the AMC business, as set forth in the Acquisition Agreement, for an all-cash purchase price of $2.275 billion, before taxes, fees and other adjustments. The Acquisition Agreement contains customary representations, warranties and covenants for a transaction of this type, including a covenant providing for each of the parties to use reasonable efforts to cause the AMC Acquisition to be consummated. Subject to certain limitations, the Company and OpenText have also agreed to indemnify each other for certain liabilities that have been specifically allocated between the parties. The Company and OpenText will also enter into a Transition Services Agreement at the closing of the AMC Acquisition, pursuant to which OpenText and its affiliates will provide support for a period of up to 24 months from the closing of the AMC Acquisition to the Company in connection with the AMC business. _The Financing Transactions_ In connection with the AMC Acquisition, we intend to consummate the following financing transactions: - the issuance of $1,000 million in aggregate principal amount of the notes offered hereby; - (i) the amendment of certain terms of the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility (as defined herein) to, among other things, (v) increase the aggregate principal amount of commitments by approximately $222 million to approximately $375 million, (w) extend the maturity date of certain of the revolving commitments thereunder from November 28, 2026 to August 29, 2028 (the “Extended First Lien Revolving Credit Facility”), (x) increase the applicable margin for adjusted SOFR to 4.00%, (y) increase the first lien net leverage ratio financial covenant, to an amount not to exceed 8.00 to 1.00 and (z) add requirements for certain of our subsidiaries incorporated under the laws of England and Wales to guarantee and secure the obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities and (ii) enter into (x) a Euro-denominated incremental term loan facility (the “Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility”) under the credit agreement governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans (as defined herein) and (y) a U.S. dollar-denominated term loan facility (the “USD Incremental Term Loan Facility” and, together with the Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility, the “Incremental First Lien Term Loan Facilities” and, together with the Extended First Lien Revolving Credit Facility, the “Incremental Senior Secured Credit Facilities”) in the form of a side car term loan facility or an incremental term loan facility under the credit agreement governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans, as applicable, in a combined aggregate principal amount of $1,000 million (reflecting U.S. dollar-equivalent for the Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility), in each case with a syndicate of lenders, that will rank pari passu with the Existing First Lien Term Loans and that will mature on November 28, 2028; and - the cash contribution of approximately $200 million in common equity directly or indirectly to the Company or a parent entity of the Company by certain investment funds affiliated with Bain Capital along with any additional co-investors designated by Bain Capital (including existing equityholders of the Company), the cash proceeds of which will be further contributed to the Company (the “Equity Contribution” and, collectively with the offering of the notes, the incurrence of the Incremental Senior Secured Credit Facilities and, in each case, the use of proceeds therefrom, the “Financing Transactions”). We intend to use the net proceeds from the offering of the notes, together with borrowings under our Incremental First Lien Term Loan Facilities, proceeds from the Equity Contribution and cash on hand, to (i) finance and consummate the AMC Acquisition and (ii) pay transaction expenses and fees in connection with the foregoing. ----- In this offering memorandum, we refer to the AMC Acquisition and the Financing Transactions collectively as the “Transactions.”

Section Title: THE OFFERING
Subsection Title: Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption ..........................................
Subsubsection Text: This offering may be consummated prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition. If the issue date of the notes occurs prior to the Acquisition Date, the Issuer will execute and deliver the Escrow Agreement and will deposit, or cause to be deposited, an amount equal to the gross proceeds from the offering of the notes into the Escrow Account for the benefit of the holders of the notes pending the consummation of the AMC Acquisition. The release of Escrowed Property to the Issuer to consummate the AMC Acquisition will be subject to the satisfaction of the Escrow Release Conditions, including the closing of the AMC Acquisition substantially concurrently with or promptly following the release of the Escrowed Property. The consummation of the AMC Acquisition is subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory conditions. As of the date of this offering memorandum, the regulatory conditions in the Acquisition Agreement have been satisfied. If (i) the closing of the AMC Acquisition has not occurred on or prior to the Outside Date, (ii) we notify the Trustee in writing prior to the Outside Date that we will not pursue the consummation of the AMC Acquisition or (iii) the Acquisition Agreement has been terminated prior to the Outside Date without the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, we will be required to redeem all of the outstanding notes at a redemption price equal to 100% of the outstanding principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, from and including the issue date of the notes, or the most recent date to which interest has been paid on the notes, whichever is later, to, but not including, the special mandatory redemption date. The Escrow Account will not include cash to fund any accrued and unpaid interest owing to holders of the notes, which is included in the special mandatory redemption price. In the event that the special mandatory price payable upon such special mandatory redemption for the notes exceeds the amount of the applicable Escrowed Property, the Issuer will be required to fund the difference between the applicable special mandatory redemption price and the amount of the Escrowed Property (plus certain fees and expenses) pursuant to a ----- commitment provided by it. See “Description of Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption.” Guarantees ................................................** If this offering is consummated prior to the Acquisition Date, then prior to the Acquisition Date and pending the release of the Escrowed Property, if applicable, the notes will not be guaranteed. From and after the Acquisition Date and following the release of the Escrowed Property, if applicable, the notes will be jointly and severally, irrevocably, fully and unconditionally guaranteed on a senior secured basis by the Guarantors. Security ......................................................** If this offering is consummated prior to the Acquisition Date, then prior to the Acquisition Date and pending the release of the Escrowed Property, if applicable, the notes will be secured only by a first priority security interest in the Escrow Account and Escrowed Property. From and after the Acquisition Date and following the release of the Escrowed Property, if applicable, the notes and related guarantees will be secured by a first-priority lien, subject to certain exceptions and permitted liens, on all of the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ existing and future assets that secure the Senior Secured Credit Facilities. First Lien Intercreditor Agreement ........** We will enter into an intercreditor agreement (the “First Lien Intercreditor Agreement”) with the Notes Collateral Agent (as defined herein), Royal Bank of Canada, acting as the administrative agent and collateral agent under the credit agreement governing our Senior Secured Credit Facilities (other than the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility if the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility is incurred in the form of a side car term loan facility) (the “Bank Collateral Agent”) and, if the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility is incurred in the form of a side car term loan facility, Royal Bank of Canada, acting as the administrative agent and collateral agent under the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility (the “Side Car Collateral Agent”). The First Lien Intercreditor Agreement will set forth the rights of, and relationship among, the Notes Collateral Agent, the Trustee, the holders of the notes, the Bank Collateral Agent, the Side Car Collateral Agent (if applicable) and the lenders under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the applicable representative of the holders under any other future parity lien debt party thereto in respect of the exercise of rights and remedies against the collateral of the Issuer and the Guarantors. In addition, holders of the notes will waive a number of rights otherwise accruing to secured lenders in bankruptcy. For a description of the First Lien Intercreditor Agreement, see “Description of Notes—Security for the Notes—First Lien Intercreditor Agreement.” Ranking .....................................................** From and after the Acquisition Date and following the release of the Escrowed Property, if applicable, the notes and the related guarantees will be the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ senior secured obligations and will be secured on a _pari passu basis with the Senior Secured Credit Facilities. The notes and the related guarantees will: - be effectively senior in right of payment to all of the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ existing and future junior lien and unsecured senior ----- debt, including the Existing Notes, to the extent of the value of the collateral securing the notes; - be effectively pari passu in right of payment with the Senior Secured Credit Facilities and all future indebtedness of the Issuer secured by a first-priority lien on the collateral securing the notes; - rank equally in right of payment with any of the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ obligations under any existing and future senior indebtedness and other obligations that are not, by their terms expressly subordinated in right of payment to the notes, including the Existing Notes and the Senior Secured Credit Facilities; - rank senior in right of payment to any of the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ existing and future subordinated indebtedness; and - be structurally subordinated to all of the existing and future indebtedness and other liabilities of the Issuer’s subsidiaries that do not guarantee the notes. On a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, as of December 31, 2023, the Issuer and the Guarantors would have had approximately $4,634 million of total long-term debt outstanding (including the notes offered hereby), of which $595 million would have been unsecured indebtedness, consisting principally of the Existing Notes, and $4,039 million would have been secured indebtedness, consisting of the notes offered hereby and borrowings outstanding under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, and the Company would have had $374 million of availability to incur additional secured indebtedness under its Extended First Lien Revolving Credit Facility (as defined herein) (after giving effect to letters of credit issued thereunder). Optional Redemption ...............................** We may redeem some or all of the notes at any time prior to    , 2025 at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the notes redeemed, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the redemption date, plus a “make-whole” premium and, at any time on or after    , 2025, at the redemption prices specified under “Description of Notes— Optional Redemption.” In addition, at any time prior to     , 2025, up to 40% of the aggregate principal amount of the notes may be redeemed with the net proceeds of certain equity offerings, at the redemption price specified under “Description of Notes—Optional Redemption.” In addition, until     , 2025, we may redeem up to 10% of the original aggregate principal amount of the notes during each twelve-month period commencing from the issue date of the notes at a redemption price of 103% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the redemption date. Change of Control ....................................** If we experience certain change of control triggering events, we must offer to purchase the notes at 101% of their principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the purchase date. A change of control will be permitted and will not constitute a change of control triggering event if (i) the consolidated total leverage ratio of the Company would be no greater than 6.00 to 1.00 on a pro forma basis as of the date of consummation of a permitted change of control (such date, -----

We define our nonGAAP financial measures as follows: - Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue is revenue resulting from the annualized value of invoices for active maintenance and term/subscription contracts (including expired contracts that have a high probability of renewal within twelve months of the previously ended term) as of the last day of the reporting period, plus royalty, perpetual license, professional service and other revenue calculated on a last-twelve-month basis. Revenue is reported on a pro forma basis (including the historical financial performance of acquisitions prior to the applicable acquisition date for all periods presented) and excludes the impact of purchase accounting adjustments for deferred revenue and backlog intangible asset amortization; ----- - Non-GAAP Cost of Revenue is cost of revenue, excluding amortization of acquired technology and employee stock compensation and other one-time expenses and including certain pro forma cost of revenue adjustments. - Non-GAAP Gross Profit is Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue less Non-GAAP Cost of Revenue, which is GAAP cost of revenue adjusted for amortization of intangible assets, stock compensation and other, and certain pro forma adjustments (including the historical financial performance of acquisitions prior to the applicable acquisition date for all periods presented); - EBITDA is net income (loss), excluding interest expense, other income (expense), employee stock compensation expense, income taxes and depreciation and amortization expenses; - Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA is EBITDA, on a pro forma basis (including the historical financial performance of acquisitions prior to the applicable acquisition date for all periods presented), adjusted for Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue, and excluding costs or income relating to acquisitions, debt refinancing, management consulting, recruiting, employee termination and severance, restructuring, litigation, new product design and development, and other items that are considered non-core to business operations; - Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA is Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA as further adjusted to give effect to restructuring activities and planned synergies related to certain acquisitions, including, as indicated, with and without, the AMC Acquisition; - Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA Margin is Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA divided by Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue; - Free Cash Flow is Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA less capital expenditures, inclusive of financing lease payments; and - Free Cash Flow Conversion is Free Cash Flow divided by Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA. Certain of our Non-GAAP Metrics in this section have been calculated utilizing accounting principles not consistent with GAAP, including recognizing revenue on an ARR basis rather than in accordance with ASC 606. A primary difference between ARR and ASC 606 is the accounting for license revenue in our subscription or term license arrangements, which is annualized and recognized over the contract term under our ARR method, while recognized at a point in time, generally at the inception of the contract term, under ASC 606. Our Non-GAAP Metrics should not be considered as alternatives to net income (loss), revenue or other measures of performance derived in accordance with GAAP as measures of operating performance or operating cash flows or as measures of liquidity. We believe that these measures are useful financial metrics to assess our operating performance from period to period by excluding certain items that we believe are not representative of our core business. We believe that they provide investors with a useful tool for assessing the comparability between periods of our ability to generate cash from operations sufficient to pay taxes, to service debt and to undertake capital expenditures. We use these measures for business planning purposes and in measuring our performance relative to that of our competitors. Our use of the Non-GAAP metrics varies from others in our industry. Non-GAAP Metrics have important limitations as analytical tools and you should not consider them in isolation or as substitutes for analysis of our results as reported under GAAP. In addition, the “Pro Forma” information presented herein under the “Pro Forma” column for the year ended December 31, 2023 reflects certain adjustments as described under “Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information” that were not applied to the “Pro Forma” information presented under the “Historical” columns for the years ended December 31, 2023, 2022 and 2021, including Pro Forma Adjusted ----- EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA, Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA Margin and certain other Non-GAAP Metrics. These metrics are therefore not fully comparable. Furthermore, the Non-GAAP Metrics that include the AMC business for the year ended December 31, 2022 do not include the same pro forma adjustments reflected in the pro forma financial information for the year ended December 31, 2023 and as set forth in “Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Financial Information” and represent a management combined presentation whereby the Non-GAAP Metrics of the AMC business for the year ended December 31, 2022 were added together with the Non-GAAP Metrics of Rocket for the same year, with certain adjustments as described below. Subsubsection Text: In light of the significance of the AMC Acquisition, this offering memorandum includes audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business as of and for the fiscal years ended December 31, 2023 and 2022. OpenText acquired Micro Focus on January 31, 2023. The AMC business has historically operated as part of Micro Focus or, following acquisition thereof, OpenText and not as a standalone company. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business included elsewhere in this offering memorandum are presented on a “carve-out” basis from (i) Micro Focus’s accounting records for the period from January 1, 2022 to January 31, 2023 and (ii) OpenText’s accounting records for the period from and after February 1, 2023, using the historical results of operations, cash flows, assets and liabilities of the AMC business. For the period from January 1, 2022 to January 31, 2023, the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business exclude OT Connectivity. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business include allocations of corporate expenses and shared expenses from Micro Focus and OpenText, as applicable, and may not fully reflect what the AMC business’s financial position, results of operations or cash flows would have been had it been a standalone company during the periods presented. As a result, the audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business included elsewhere in this offering memorandum are not necessarily indicative of the AMC business’s future results of operations, financial position or cash flows. The audited combined carveout financial statements of the AMC business were prepared in accordance with GAAP. You should read the following tables together with “AMC Business’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations” and the AMC business’s audited combined carveout financial statements and accompanying notes thereto included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. -----

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsubsection Title: We derive a significant portion of our revenue from a long-term strategic partnership with IBM and loss of significant revenue from this partnership would have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition, results of operations and prospects.
Subsubsection Text: We derive a significant portion of our revenue from a long-term strategic partnership with IBM. For the fiscal years ended December 31, 2023 and 2022 and the pro forma combined fiscal year ended December 31, 2023, we generated approximately 38%, 35% and 23%, respectively, of our total Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue from this partnership. No other customer or partner accounted for more than 3% of our total revenue during the fiscal years ended December 31, 2023 and 2022. We are a party to a master licensed works agreement (the “MLWA”) with IBM to develop and update mission-critical software products for IBM’s core platforms. IBM is not obligated under the MLWA to issue new statements of work or work orders to us, nor is IBM required to spend a minimum amount with us in any period. As a result, there can be no assurance that the volume of work to be performed by us under the MLWA and the revenue we generate therefrom will not vary significantly from year to year, which could in turn cause our revenue to vary significantly from year to year and could potentially decrease in the future by material amounts. We may experience loss or reduction of business under the MLWA for any reason, including the royalties received for and quality of the products and services we provide. In addition, IBM has its own policies and guidelines that control its promotion and distribution practices and, pursuant to the terms of the MLWA, has the ability to change unilaterally how they promote and/or distribute the products we build for them. Accordingly, IBM may reduce prices to its end users, which would reduce the corresponding royalties to us. IBM may also demand increased quality standards or, under certain circumstances, transfer some or all of the work and services we currently provide in-house or to our current or future competitors. Alternatively, unexpected adverse events affecting the financial condition or business strategy of IBM could result in a reduction or delay in work orders from or a delay or default in payment by IBM. Our future growth will depend in part on IBM’s ability to market and sell our products and services and the loss of significant revenue under this partnership would have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition, results of operations and prospects.

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsubsection Title: If customers do not renew their contracts with us, our revenue will decline, and our business and financial condition may be adversely affected.
Subsubsection Text: Renewals of existing maintenance contracts and subscriptions are handled primarily by our centralized renewal team, who have helped to drive our consistently high gross and net retention rates, which have averaged 92% and 102%, respectively, since 2020. However, these retention rates may decline or fluctuate in the future. In order for us to maintain or improve our results of operations, it is important that our customers renew their maintenance contracts and subscriptions when existing terms expire. Our customers have no obligation to renew after the expiration of their contractual period and in the normal course of business, some customers have elected not to renew. Our direct sales force for our Rocket-branded products develops relationships directly with our customers. Our enterprise sales professionals focus on building long term relationships with key customers, minimizing cancellations and maximizing renewal revenue, while our product specialists identify new opportunities for additional capacity. -----

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsubsection Title: If we are unable to attract new customers or convert our single-product customers into multi-product customers in a manner that is cost-effective, our growth could be slower than we expect, and our business may be harmed.
Subsubsection Text: Demand for our products is affected by a number of factors, many of which are beyond our control, such as continued market acceptance of our products, the timing of development and release of new features and functions, technological change, growth or contraction in our addressable market, operating systems and applications and macroeconomic changes on the demand for technology solutions like ours.
