Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
Subsubsection Text: The AMC business’s exposure to interest rate risk is minimal as it does not hold any financial instruments with significant interest rate sensitivity. The management of the AMC business regularly assesses the nature and extent of the AMC business’s exposure to interest rate risks.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
Subsubsection Title: Foreign Currency Risk Foreign currency transaction risk
Subsubsection Text: The AMC business transacts in various foreign currencies. Foreign currency exposures typically arise from transactions that are expected to be cash settled in the near term and are transacted in non-functional currency. Management expects that the AMC business will continue to realize gains or losses with respect to the AMC business’s foreign currency exposures. The ultimate realized gain or loss with respect to foreign currency exposures will generally depend on the size and type of cross-currency transactions that the AMC business enters into, the currency exchange rates associated with these exposures and changes in those rates. The AMC business has not entered into derivatives or hedging transactions as exposure to foreign currency exchange rates has not been material to the audited combined carveout financial statements. -----

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
Subsubsection Text: The AMC business’s reporting currency is the U.S. dollar. Fluctuations in foreign currencies impact the amount of total assets and liabilities that the AMC business reports for foreign subsidiaries upon the translation of these amounts into U.S. dollars. -----

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
Subsubsection Text: The AMC business is primarily exposed to market risks associated with fluctuations in interest rates and foreign currency exchange rates.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Rocket is a leading global enterprise software provider with a broad portfolio of products that help corporations, government agencies, and other organizations run their mission-critical IT operations. We enable small and large enterprises in many industries to maximize their data, systems and infrastructure to deliver critical services that power our modern world. Our software runs, optimizes and protects our customers’ applications, servers and databases, and integrates these core platforms with the rest of the enterprise, while providing a full-stack of modernization solutions. Our products enable customers to carry out their most mission-critical business functions, such as processing payment transactions at global financial institutions and maintaining healthcare records at hospitals and insurance companies. Since our founding over 30 years ago, we have cultivated a customer-centric culture with strategic investments in R&D that provide a wide range of solutions to meet customers’ evolving needs. We have evolved from solely maintaining legacy infrastructure to facilitating modernization journeys to connect mainframe to the hybrid cloud environment. We have accomplished this evolution through substantial R&D efforts, highlighted by over $500 million in investments into R&D since 2020, as well as multiple acquisitions that have expanded our modernization offering. Given our focus on supporting our customers’ mission-critical business functions, our products address deeply embedded technologies that sit at the core of enterprise IT infrastructure. These systems have evolved over multiple decades and, particularly for our largest customers, represent billions of dollars of cumulative custom application development and IT infrastructure investment. As enterprises look to the future, hybrid remains vital to enabling the deployment of cloud environments as it incorporates client server computing, cloud-based platforms, and modern connectivity and portability. We seek to enable our customers to experience the best of both the cloud and the mainframe, putting relevant workloads in the cloud while leveraging the mainframe for its best features – security, reliability, and governance. Our strategy is to modernize without disruption, meeting customers where they are in their modernization journey. By utilizing our product portfolio, customers can modernize effectively, even incrementally, integrating new technologies while preserving and leveraging the robust foundation already in place for a seamless technological evolution. We believe this approach dramatically lowers risk and improves success rates of IT system modernization projects. As the pace of digital transformation continues to accelerate, we believe our customers will increasingly look to us to extract greater value from existing IT systems and applications through innovation, integration, optimization and modernization. Today, Rocket is organized into three main business units focused on Infrastructure Modernization, Data Modernization and Application Modernization. While each business unit has its own technical requirements and products, we go to market using a holistic approach to solving our customers’ problems, utilizing solutions across our business units to help drive operating efficiencies among overlapping buying centers to best position us to drive future growth. These business units are as follows: _Infrastructure Modernization: Our Infrastructure Modernization business unit represents approximately_ 55% of our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It comprises software solutions built for integrating and optimizing mainframe workloads, mitigating security and compliance risks and optimizing storage. Organizations can leverage our range of solutions to support mainframe security and compliance in the face of new threats and deliver optimized mainframe performance management and interoperability. The mainframe continues to be an integral part of modern-day IT infrastructure and provides a reliable architecture for high-volume data processing and transactions. Mainframes provide a level of five 9s of availability (99.999%), which is several orders of magnitude higher than alternative distributed servers, making mainframes the optimal platform for mission-critical processes. Additionally, mainframes are uniquely engineered to process millions of input and output calculations per second, which is a key difference from distributed servers that are designed to be more general purpose, limiting their ability to perform a specialized task extremely well. Consequently, mainframes provide a range of advantages over distributed systems that are likely to persist, and we believe organizations in regulated and ----- data intensive industries will continue to rely on mainframe systems to process high-volume, missioncritical activity at the core of their IT infrastructures. _Data Modernization: Our Data Modernization business unit represents approximately 18% of our_ standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It provides software solutions to connect mission-critical data residing on the mainframe and distributed systems to advanced applications and compute workloads running on private and public cloud environments. As organizations increasingly adopt a hybrid cloud infrastructure approach to operations, effectively navigating the complexities of data governance and compliance while maximizing data utilization is critical. Our solutions address this challenge by eliminating data siloes to enhance decision-making and customer experience while maintaining strong data governance, security, scalability and dynamic availability. For example, one of our key products, Mobius, enables customers to integrate seamlessly with third-party repositories, facilitating secure and efficient data movement between modern and legacy systems. Our track record of successfully integrating acquisitions within this business unit highlights our commitment to providing an end-to-end offering that reframes customer engagement strategies and paves the way for future growth. _Application Modernization: Our Application Modernization business unit represents the remaining 27% of_ our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It is comprised of a portfolio of solutions aimed at improving application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating modern workflows for legacy applications. While Application Modernization covers both distributed offmainframe platforms and mainframe environments, many of the most important back-end applications for large enterprises still reside on the mainframe and have yet to be modernized. With key offerings including database management, DevOps, and low-code application development platforms, we enable organizations to efficiently deliver reliable, scalable and secure applications to support their core business needs. One of our key innovations has been to enable enterprise adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern development practices even for legacy systems. Across these three business units, we serve over 12,500 end-user customers, pro forma for the AMC Acquisition. Our customer base spans every major industry vertical and includes some of the largest companies in the world, including 43 of the Fortune 50, as of 2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition). Our customer base is highly diversified with the top ten Rocket-led customers representing just 14% of revenue in the year ended December 31, 2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition). In addition to these deeply embedded and long-term customer relationships, we have also cultivated a number of partnerships that are critical to our business. Our largest partnership is with IBM. We generate approximately 23% of our revenue through IBM-led sales. Through a series of organic R&D investments, acquisitions, joint development efforts and a strong GTM partnership, we have become one of IBM’s most trusted software partners. This partnership has evolved over 30 years and is driven primarily by our expertise in mainframe and mid-range servers of which IBM is a major manufacturer. Our software enhances and creates efficiencies for IBM’s customers and extends the life of IBM’s core platforms. In partnership with IBM, we develop and support core software offerings in their portfolio, freeing IBM to redirect their R&D spend to other areas. As part of our partnership with IBM, numerous Rocket products are re-branded as IBM products and sold through their global salesforce. While we are committed to remaining a high-quality business partner to IBM and extending the lifetime value of core IBM-led products, we are working to increase the share of Rocket-led sales to further diversify our revenue. Our Rocket-led GTM strategy, whether executed directly or through our channel partners, allows us to provide best-inclass support to our customers in managing their mainframe and modernization journey, particularly as they move towards a hybrid cloud environment. We are headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts and maintain a large global footprint with significant operations in North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia and Australia. As of December 31, 2023 we had 2,200 employees (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition) worldwide with a presence in 13 global offices. Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to have approximately 3,000 Rocketeers and 20 global offices. This worldwide coverage provides us with access to economies of scale, lower cost offshore operations, high-growth emerging markets and global support for our increasingly global customer base. -----

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Acquisition of Application Modernization and Connectivity
Subsubsection Text: On November 28, 2023, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the AMC business of OpenText, which includes historically a product group of Micro Focus and, beginning February 1, 2023, the OT Connectivity business, a product group of OpenText, for an all-cash purchase price of $2.275 billion, before taxes, fees and other adjustments. For more information, see “Summary––The AMC Acquisition.” The AMC business has been a leader in application modernization for many years with a focus on mainframe replatforming solutions that help with the migration and operation of mainframe workloads to distributed and cloud environments. For the year ended December 31, 2023, the AMC business generated Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue of $504 million and Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA of $307 million. AMC Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue is comprised of (x) for the year ended December 31, 2022, approximately $355 million of ARR, $108 million of perpetual license revenue and $13 million of professional service revenue, and (y) for the year ended December 31, 2023, approximately $364 million of ARR, $121 million of perpetual license revenue and $20 million of professional services revenue. The AMC business operates within five portfolio segments that form a comprehensive suite for mainframe application development, maintenance and modernization: _Enterprise Suite: The AMC business’s Enterprise Suite business unit represents approximately 18% of its_ revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution is the AMC business’s fastest growing product line, providing end-to-end mainframe workload migration tools including migration analysis, test and deployment tools and an enterprise server that emulates the mainframe environment in the cloud. The Enterprise Suite helps organizations move mainframe workloads to run on distributed environments with a significantly lower degree of code change relative to other complex migration options like refactoring. Within the Enterprise Suite, four core tools address different stages of workload migration and application development. The Analyzer, Developer and Enterprise Test Server are focused on delivering diagnostic tools, modern IDE and virtual test environments. The Enterprise Server provides a multi-platform production environment to replatform IBM z/OS applications. The revenue derived from Enterprise Server is highly recurring in nature and allows for an emulated mainframe on cloud environments with the ability to run mission-critical applications. _COBOL: The AMC business’s COBOL business unit represents approximately 36% of its revenue for the_ year ended December 31, 2023. This solution enables organizations to develop, maintain and deploy COBOL based applications across the enterprise using modern DevOps tools and platforms. COBOL is a legacy programming language that is integral to the majority of mission-critical applications. As most developers lack experience working in COBOL, a modern set of DevOps tools enables enterprises to modernize and update their most important applications. The AMC business’s tools provide an IDE for analyzing and editing COBOL in applications primarily off-mainframe, providing developers with visualizations and coding environments similar to modern IDEs. As one indicator of the AMC business’s market position, the AMC business is the only official COBOL compiler available on CSPs marketplaces. _Host Connectivity: The AMC business’s Host Connectivity business unit represents approximately 32% of_ its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution includes mainframe terminal emulators and plugins for application access, process automation and security solutions. Customer use cases include providing flexible access to mission-critical applications running on mainframe environments via modern, distributed systems (desktop, web and mobile) in a secure and compliant manner (i.e. multi factor authentication). The AMC business’s Host Connectivity tools provide a broad number of options that allow for significant customization to deliver strong, auditable and compliant security that meets organizations’ requirements. _Mainframe Application Development Life Cycle Management: The AMC business’s Mainframe ADLM_ business unit represents approximately 11% of its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution provides mainframe source code change, configuration and management enabling organizations to modernize and integrate mainframes across new technologies and platforms. This results in shorter app delivery cycles, stronger security and increased productivity. Customer use cases include version control functionality to track changes made to source code (i.e. ChangeMan ZMF), change management workflow, release management and automation, automated testing, auditing and reporting. ----- _CORBA: The AMC business’s COBRA business unit represents approximately 3% of its revenue for the_ year ended December 31, 2023. This solution provides middleware for communication across distributed applications. CORBA add-on solutions enable any CORBA application to take advantage of new deployment models, including cloud, containers and virtual environments or to extend and re-use existing CORBA resources without prior knowledge of CORBA technology. These solutions are used in telecommunications for managing network elements and the integration of different vendor equipment, in military and defense for building command and control systems and in finance for trading and risk management systems. The AMC Acquisition represents a highly complementary addition to our product portfolio, with the AMC business expected to further build out a more diverse modernization portfolio that aligns with customer demands and allows us to meet our customers wherever they are on their modernization journey. The AMC Acquisition is expected to achieve key strategic objectives, including: - Expanding the product portfolio with a stronger, more comprehensive modernization offering that is able to meet customers at any stage of their IT modernization journey, whether modernizing in place, migrating select workloads to hybrid environments or replatforming; - Providing a full-stack of products and solutions to enable end-to-end modernization without the disruption of existing workflows and allow customers to derive value from their decades of investment in core applications; - Expanding customer reach through deeper and broader customer engagement across Fortune 2000 accounts for greater retention and cross-selling. A more comprehensive and complete offering solidifies Rocket as the strategic partner of choice to address customer needs, tapping into developer-led decisions and guiding customers through their modernization journey over time, ultimately expanding Rocket’s relevance; - Tapping into CSP budget pools through the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities, augmenting our existing hybrid cloud solutions suite and expanding our footprint with CSPs including Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure as preferred replatforming partners; - Expanding our global reach, with a stronger presence in EMEA, Asia Pacific, and Latin American channels, thus diversifying our revenue sources and redistributing geographic concentrations; and - Combining R&D engines to drive increased innovation, better modernization capabilities and more elegant solutions to further accelerate a shifty to hybrid cloud technology. The AMC business’s additional resources for innovation will foster continuous R&D innovation through the application of emerging technologies like generative artificial intelligence. Acquiring the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs, including Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure, is expected to enable us to tap into new budget pools and augment our existing hybrid cloud solutions suite. Rocket has broken down the boundaries of on-premises and cloud computing so that businesses can connect IT systems and modern applications. The seamless data flow, data integration and continuous enhancements create benefits like streamlined processes, improved efficiencies, and better return on investment so that customers can be more dynamic, secure, and agile in the face of an increasingly complex IT and business environment. Access to the AMC business’s additional software developers will drive increased innovation and development of better solutions to accelerate a shift to a hybrid cloud environment, reinforcing our commitment to our customer-centric R&D efforts. This move is expected to further strengthen our position as the partner of choice for mission-critical IT modernization.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Our marketing and GTM strategies are driven, first and foremost, to deliver the right solutions to customers, regardless of channel. To that end, our sales and marketing efforts are bifurcated between our Rocket-led products and our IBMled products, each of which have their own strategies. ----- Our Rocket-led products are sold through two primary avenues: (1) direct to customer through our centralized customer success, support and delivery teams and (2) channel partners. - Our direct sales force and marketing investment, which is focused on Rocket-led solutions, is shifting the dialogue from mainframe buying centers to a CIO and CPO strategy covering the expanse of Rocket use cases. We rely on marketing to drive brand awareness, generate leads across our growth product areas and support subscription and maintenance renewals by reinforcing the value delivered by our new releases and product innovation. Through our 30-year operating history and over 50 acquisitions, we have a strong base of customers that we continually look to serve with our growing portfolio of solutions. Our sales force targets both existing customers and new logo opportunities and is comprised of a global set of enterprise sales professionals focused on account relationships. Our enterprise sales professionals are product specialists who focus on selling our solutions with our solutions engineers providing technical guidance to customers throughout the sales process. This team handles new sales as well as up-sells and cross-sells within existing accounts, further driving revenue expansion. Renewals of existing maintenance contracts and subscriptions are handled by our centralized renewal team, who have helped to drive our consistently high renewal rates. - In addition to our direct sales force, our Rocket-led sales organization also leads our strategic alliances. Our 10 strategic channel partner relationships consist of resellers, distributors and systems integrators who embed our solutions in other software applications and help to deliver new solutions to market. Our strong relationships with Independent ISVs and MSPs enable us to better reach both current and potential customers, and these strong MSP relationships also support customers using MSPs to manage their mainframe. For our IBM-led products, we have a dedicated sales enablement team across the IBM OEM product segments, all backed by a 30-year longstanding partnership driving us and IBM to partner on opportunities and deployments. These joint Rocket-IBM sales and marketing initiatives allow us to drive demand, refine messaging, enable sales and strengthen win rates for our IBM-led products, which continue to have strong retention rates supported by the strength of our partnership with IBM. In addition to benefits that we realize from the partnership, IBM also leverages us to support the broader mainframe industry and expand value delivered from incumbent involvement. Ultimately, our powerful GTM strategy is bolstered by a centralized customer success and support effort with global coverage, a dedicated team focused on renewals and driving upsell and cross-sell opportunities across the installed base, numerous strategic alliances that help market and distribute our solutions and a robust partnership with IBM. The combination of these factors forms our strong customer success engine and continues to help us drive strong retention rates. We have further built our business to serve the expanding needs of our customers and address growing budget pools that are focused on digital transformation. We’ve transitioned from a focus on providing solutions to the head of infrastructure to addressing a head of applications or a Chief Data Officer who is focused on driving revenue generation of their business. Whether it is the CIO or the Chief Data Officer, we have solutions that address their mission-critical challenges and our GTM approach ensures that we serve the different needs of our expanded buyer set. The combined forces of Rocket and the AMC business are expected to create a broader product offering that serves the entire modernization continuum, all in a single partner. As one example of how the AMC Acquisition will help broaden our product offering and modernization capabilities, we expect the AMC business to provide us with additional GTM channels to tap into CSP budget pools given the AMC business’s strength in replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs. We believe this will further elevate Rocket’s status with MSPs, CSPs and other key ecosystem participants, further strengthening and differentiating our GTM strategy.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: _Deep and Embedded Portfolio of Solutions Meets Customer Needs Across Environments_ ----- Since our founding, we have focused strategically on innovation to develop and enhance our software solutions to consistently meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our portfolio of solutions represents a full-stack of purpose-built products tailored to various end markets. Within each of these environments, we address customer pain points at every layer of their IT system. This ranges from the core IT infrastructure (i.e. software tooling for the mainframe itself or an embedded database) to newly developed applications that are open source in nature and run in the cloud but need to integrate with the more traditional components of a customer’s IT system. In delivering this comprehensive portfolio of products, we focus on opportunities categorized within our three synergistic business lines: Infrastructure Modernization, Data Modernization and Application Modernization. We expect the AMC Acquisition to bring a suite of tools with a focus on mainframe modernization and replatforming that help with the migration of critical mainframe workloads to distributed and cloud environments. The AMC Acquisition is expected to broaden our existing product portfolio with complementary modernization solutions and an increased focus on enabling migration to the cloud. Illustrative use cases that enable customers throughout their modernization journey include but are not limited to: - Creating modern platforms and tools that are faster, cheaper and lower risk than replacing incumbent systems to modernize; - Providing a toolset for mainframe replatforming and management of critical mainframe migration workloads; - Providing the tools for modern, compliant, and agile developer experiences; - Managing and operating core IT infrastructure more efficiently without forcing disruptive re-platforming; - Connecting legacy systems with cloud infrastructure; and - Managing accelerating data growth and provide real-time access for AI, ML, data and analytics. By focusing on providing a full-stack solution to these deeply embedded technologies and environments, we believe we have established ourselves as a highly valued and differentiated provider to our customers and partners. _Long-Term, Blue-Chip Customers Rely on Rocket to Modernize Mission-Critical Applications_ Over our 30-year history we have created and developed deeply embedded relationships with a wide array of customers ranging from small and mid-market businesses to governments and the largest enterprises in the world. Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to serve over 12,500 end-user customers across a broad range of industries with particular strength in financial services, aerospace and defense, automotive manufacturing, retail, government and healthcare. Our customer base also includes governments, major telecommunications companies, educational institutions, retailers and other institutions, as well as channel partners including IT outsourcing providers, distributors and systems integrators. Our strong presence in numerous industry verticals helps to diversify our revenue base, and the mission-critical nature of our products mitigates the risk of industry-specific and cyclical downturns. Our customers include 86% of the Fortune 50, as of 2023. 28 of the top 30 Fortune 50 companies trust and use Rocket, as well as all top 10 commercial banks. ----- We expect the AMC Acquisition to bring approximately 5,000 global blue chip customer accounts with significant overlap to Rocket’s existing customer base, diversifying our revenue sources and geographic reach with a stronger presence in EMEA, Asia Pacific, and Latin American channels while retaining a core revenue base in North America.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Fiscal Year 2023 Revenue by Top Customers[(1)] Fiscal Year 2023 Revenue by End Market[(1)]
Subsubsection Text: Finance, Insurance, and Real Estate 32% Transportation, Communications All Other 15% Other 57% Top 10 14% 11-50 18% 51-100 11% 3% Retail Trade 4% Wholesale 6% Manufacturing 7% Services Public Administration 25% 8% (1) Represents Rocket Software standalone revenue only; excludes IBM. _Customer-Centric R&D Drives Value Proposition and Customer Stickiness_ With nearly 1,900 Rocketeer Engineers (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition) and an R&D presence in five continents, we are committed to developing and maintaining a strong R&D organization. This commitment has enabled us to continuously adapt to and meet our customers’ evolving needs by enhancing our existing products and developing new ones. Our customer-first approach to development has driven a customer satisfaction score of 94% for 2023. We created our business units to help organize R&D by underlying system type and technology themes to better align with our customers’ needs and increase accountability and ownership of results. As a result, we develop a granular view on key R&D investment strategies that minimize cost overruns or delays and have a targeted R&D strategy to ----- better serve key customers and channel partners. As a global research organization, we also have access to a wide and deep pool of talent across both high-cost and low-cost centers to drive efficiencies. The strength of our R&D efforts has translated into competitive wins in the market. For example, the largest Italian postal group, a long-term Rocket Mobius customer, upgraded its existing content management system (Mobius) that enabled the use of Mobius with their Amazon Web Services platform, benefitting from Rocket’s investments in hybrid cloud enablement and API integrations. Our efforts in improving UI and UX in application modernization products provided a leading global provider of financial market infrastructure services with a better sign-in experience for clients which was previously a key pain point. Our customer-centric R&D approach enhances our value proposition and drives customer stickiness. The acquisition reinforces and magnifies Rocket’s commitment to innovation and R&D, incorporating cloud, AI and ML alongside the company’s decades-long development and track record in mission-critical systems.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: R&D as a Percentage of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue
Subsubsection Text: (1) 16% 14% 14% 2021 2022 2023 (1) 2021 R&D as percentage of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue does not give effect to the AMC Acquisition. 2022 R&D as a percentage of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue represents the sum of Rocket’s and the AMC business’s individual research and development costs taken as a percentage of the sum of Rocket’s and the AMC business’s NonGAAP Adjusted Revenue. 2023 R&D as a percentage of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue represents the research and development costs as a percentage of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue after giving pro forma effect to the AMC Acquisition. For a definition and more information about these metrics, see “Summary––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information.” _Diversified, End-to-End Modernization Platform Supporting Full-Stack Modernization_ Our Infrastructure Modernization, Application Modernization and Data Modernization business units form one suite of solutions that enables customers to modernize end-to-end across their IT systems and support a transition to a hybrid cloud environment. This shift in focus towards a full-stack of modernization solutions has provided us access to multiple growing budget pools. In 2018, 44% of our GTM motion was Rocket-led with the remainder being IBM-led. As of 2023 (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition), approximately 77% of our GTM motion is Rocket-led representing our evolved strategy whereby the significant majority of our GTM motion is Rocket-led. With an emphasized focus on supporting full-stack modernization, we have been able to tap into multiple budget pools expanding beyond legacy infrastructure spend and into evergreen budgets focused on digital transformation. These budget pools are controlled by several buying centers across an organization including the Chief Information Officer, Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications, Chief Information Security Officer and Head of Infrastructure, all of whom are focused on full-stack modernization. With the addition of the AMC business, we’re also increasing our exposure with developers, who are often key decision makers within DevOps budget pools for application modernization. ----- With the AMC business’s capabilities, we expect to deliver full-stack modernization solutions that vastly expand the value our customers get out of their systems and their core data thereby augmenting our customers’ ability to deliver hybrid solutions that enable new customer experiences. _Predictable, High Visibility Revenue Model_ We derive the majority of our revenues from subscriptions and maintenance, which, in conjunction with our strong historical renewal and retention rates, have provided a steady and visible revenue stream. For the year ended December 31, 2023, recurring revenue accounted for approximately 76% of our total revenues. Our software solutions are mission-critical and deeply embedded within the IT infrastructure, which results in high switching costs given the disruptive, time-consuming and resource-intensive nature of new enterprise software installations. Many of our products have been embedded in customers’ IT infrastructures for over a decade, making our products expensive and risky to replace. Furthermore, our significant domain expertise enables a high level of end-user customization, further entrenching our solutions within our customers’ business processes. Our historical gross and net revenue retention have averaged 93% and 102%, respectively since 2022.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: 76% 76% 2022 2023 (1) Represents Subscription and Maintenance revenue as a percentage of total Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue. For a definition and more information about these metrics, see “Summary––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information.” (2) Does not give effect to the AMC Acquisition. (3) Gross Retention Rate is defined as the dollar amount of the ARR defined as the normalized revenue value of active Maintenance and/or Subscription contracts to a one-year term, less product churn, less customer churn, downsells and price decreases divided by the ARR, that was up for renewal in that same period. (4) Net Retention Rate is calculated with the same numerator as gross retention and adds upsells, cross-sells and price increases, which is then divided by the ARR that was up for renewal in that same period. For the year ended December 31, 2023, the AMC business had $504 million of Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue, $307 million of Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA and a strong loss-only gross retention rate of 96%. We are comfortable with the accretive nature of this business and expect the AMC business to strengthen our client retention, broaden our cross-sell opportunities and drive sustainable growth in markets we know very well. ----- _Strong Free Cash Flow Generation_ Our high Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA margins and limited capital expenditure requirements drive significant Free Cash Flow generation. The AMC Acquisition is expected to strengthen our cash generation profile, lifting the overall Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA margin to approximately 60% and Free Cash Flow Conversion to approximately 98%. Going forward, we believe that our stable customer base and revenue visibility will enable us to continue to generate strong Free Cash Flow.

For more information about these synergies, see “––Summary Historical and Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information.” (3) Does not give effect to the AMC Acquisition. _Experienced Management Team_ Our business is run by Milan Shetti, who joined us in 2020 and now serves as CEO and President. He brings valuable experience from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, where he worked for over 10 years. Since 2019, we have made significant investments in bringing in and hiring valuable executives to lead our next phase of growth. Our leadership contributes a wide array of experiences at multiple industry-leading technology and software companies, providing valuable insights and skills that help to run our business. Over the last four years, we have enhanced our management team through the recruitment of not only new Chief Executive, Financial, Marketing, Revenue, Information, People and Legal Officers, but also two new Business Unit Presidents. These strategic new hires bring with them strong connections with IBM and other key channel partners. We maintain a partnership framework with IBM executives that facilitates alignment with functions within IBM and Rocket and, across the organization, our executives and business unit leaders maintain regular dialogue with their IBM counterparts. Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to hire Stuart McGill, the current Chief Revenue Officer of the AMC business, who has been with the company since 1984, and Neil Fowler, the current Chief Technology Officer of the Synergies $438 59% ----- AMC business, who has been with the company since 1991. Mr. McGill and Mr. Fowler would bring decades of experience and expertise to our already talented management team. We believe that our success in steadily growing Rocket as a cash-flow generative company has greatly benefitted from these strategic hires, and we anticipate continued success in the future.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: _Embrace Hybrid Cloud to Enable Enterprises to Unlock New Capabilities and Growth Opportunities and Simultaneously Optimize Mission-Critical Systems_ Through our strategy of enabling enterprises to embrace and innovate with hybrid cloud, companies can deploy, execute and manage workloads, applications and data agnostic of their chosen infrastructure in a seamless and transparent manner from mainframe to cloud. This approach allows enterprises to not only maximize the full potential and value of their data stored on mainframe, but also leverage that data to drive decisions and insights from cloudnative capabilities, including AI, ML and advanced analytics. One of our key innovations has been to enable enterprise adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern development practices even for legacy systems and which we expect the AMC Acquisition to further enhance. This will empower our customers as they pursue their modernization journeys, and we are right there with them. Ultimately, this narrative aligns the technology investments made by enterprises with their key business outcomes, providing customers with a complete lifecycle of solutions and letting them focus on business without worrying about the constraints of their current technology architecture. _Focus on R&D and Investment in Product Portfolio_ Since 2020, we have invested $521 million in R&D initiatives. With nearly 1,900 Rocketeer Engineers (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition) and an R&D presence in five continents, our R&D investment is the cornerstone of our ability to innovate, enabling us to better address customer needs, retain existing accounts and attract new business. It also allows us to provide full-stack solutions to our customers, which we believe, in conjunction with our powerful GTM team and strategy, will ultimately drive strong retention rates among our installed bases. Our customer-centric R&D shows our true understanding of the different needs of our customers and buyers who are looking to modernize their infrastructure, reinforcing, and magnifying our commitment to innovation. Additionally, because we’ve scaled the business so significantly through both organic and inorganic growth, we’ve managed to achieve significant scale efficiency in our R&D investments. _Support Full-Stack Modernization and Tap into Multiple Budget Pools_ We provide a full-stack of infrastructure, application, and data modernization solutions, allowing companies to integrate legacy and distributed systems with modern cloud capabilities. This full-stack of IT system modernization solutions allows us to tap into multiple budget pools, including those covered by the CIO, Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications, Chief Information Security Officer, Head of Infrastructure and more. With our suite of products and solutions, we can help companies ensure that their existing infrastructure is able to successfully deliver digital transformation initiatives and provide competitive advantages; deliver new mission-critical applications across hybrid infrastructures; govern and access key data and content to strengthen customer relationships and ensure compliance; and drive key initiatives to secure and protect data across the broader enterprise. This multi-layered approach opens corporate budgets beyond the mainframe and infrastructure-centric buyer and expands our wallet share to larger digital transformation initiatives that we can access through upsell and cross-sell opportunities. _Maintain Our Strong Operational Efficiency and Profitability_ Our focus on operational efficiency and disciplined expense management has helped us to maintain consistently high Adjusted EBITDA margins. This commitment to cost control has enabled our ongoing investments in R&D to further expand our solution footprint. We believe this continued emphasis on cost control results in attractive operating leverage and cash flow generation. ----- _Pursue Accretive Acquisitions to Further Supplement Our Portfolio_ Over our history, we have completed more than 50 acquisitions and developed a track record of successfully integrating acquired companies. Acquisitions have historically been completed at attractive multiples and have allowed us to further enhance our product portfolio. Our multi-prong approach to evaluating potential acquisitions includes identification of (1) Solution Enhancement, (2) Solution Expansion and (3) Synergy Realization, which allows us to be intentional and methodical throughout both the discovery and vetting processes. We focus on opportunities that accelerate the development of important underinvested functionalities, provide cross-selling opportunities, and rationalize costs through scale.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We view our business as having three distinct addressable markets, each of which is aligned with a specific business unit. While these markets are distinct in nature, there is a common thread in that the environment and underlying technology are deeply embedded and responsible for organizations’ most mission-critical functions. We expect the AMC Acquisition to further build out our product capabilities to address all customer use cases, and we will integrate the AMC business’s products into our existing business units. While investment in legacy systems has been stable, companies are increasing their spend across modernization, integration, hybridization and next-generation data applications. We are positioned to serve as a modernization partner that taps into growing budget pools focused on digital transformation across a suite of buyers with evergreen budget pools including the CIO, Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications and Head of Infrastructure. In aggregate, we view our current total addressable market as $24 billion, which sits within a broader $3.9 trillion digital transformation market. Our three current addressable markets are as follows: - _Mainframe and Hybrid Cloud Software: Our infrastructure modernization products support customers in optimizing their mainframe workloads across a broad spectrum of pathways. Based on third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to mainframe and hybrid cloud software to be approximately $11 billion. Going forward, this market is expected to grow at approximately 4% annually. We believe we have an approximately 4% market share of this addressable market. For most of our customers, the embedded nature of mainframe servers and the speed, size and security requirements of the workloads being run on them make switching away from the mainframe an expensive and difficult process. The importance of mainframe is evidenced by the fact that approximately 70% of the world’s production IT workloads are handled by mainframes. According to IBM, over $8 trillion in payments per year, and over 30 billion transactions per day, are processed by mainframes. Mainframe criticality is driven by the need for reliability, with many applications requiring high availability, and the complexity and vastness of the underlying code makes mainframe integral to operations. There are a range of advantages that mainframe offers over distributed computing including reliability, speed of computing and security. For customers who remain on the mainframe, the increased data requirements and volumes generated by the digitalization of businesses will lead to increasing mainframe workloads. For example, when retail bank account holders check their account or engage in online banking, this activity results in queries to the mainframe creating additional mainframe transaction volume. As retail banks and other institutions increase their product offerings and continue their digital transformation initiatives, the ability to connect and interact with the mainframe will be an important component of most IT deployments. Higher workload volume combined with the ongoing need to operate, optimize, and modernize the mainframe should provide continued growth opportunities within our Infrastructure Modernization business unit. We expect the AMC Acquisition to expand our product offerings in the mainframe and hybrid cloud market with Enterprise Suite, COBOL and Mainframe ADLM, enabling further modernization of mainframe applications and hybrid cloud infrastructure. With the largest companies in the world across every major industry vertical continuing to leverage mainframe technology through hybrid cloud models, we expect that hybrid infrastructure will remain the architecture of choice. By enabling core IT infrastructure to continue living in mainframe environments while leveraging APIs that provide teams and customers with access to cloud solutions and web and mobile applications, businesses are providing a modern experience for employees and end-users, without taking on additional risk. ----- - _Enterprise Content Management: Data modernization solutions enable organizations to capture, build, organize, manage and store enterprise documents and records. Using third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to ECM solutions to be approximately $5 billion. Going forward, this market is forecasted to grow at approximately 6% annually. Enterprises need to securely manage documents and records across their organization and require software that provides tools to capture, build, organize, manage and store documents and records as they flow through business processes. ECM modernization tools for mainframe-based enterprises allow organizations to utilize terabytes of stored data that are typically inaccessible and unutilized. Common applications of ECM systems for our customers involve document generation workloads, which include invoice and statement generation and ticket issuance. More advanced processes include document ingestion, robotic process automation and workflow management. For example, processing a mortgage application is a complex process involving multiple steps and systems, which can be streamlined and automated with an ECM system. ECM solutions are often embedded in core customer facing workflows and are integrated with other core IT systems (enterprise resource planning systems, customer relationship management systems, financial systems, etc.) that leverage other mainframe-stored content. The critical nature and deep integration of ECM workflows should continue to drive future growth within our Data Modernization business unit. - _App Development & Testing: Our application modernization solutions enable organizations to extract data from legacy Unix/Power Systems, modernize the experience for users and enable the usability of large scale non-relational databases. Based on third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to application development and testing to be approximately $8 billion. Going forward, this market is forecasted to grow by approximately 5% annually. Organizations use application modernization products to improve application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating modern workflows for legacy applications in a safe and secure way. Common uses of application modernization products include enabling application development on top of mission-critical non-relational databases, removing complexity from building modern apps on legacy platforms with low- or no-code solutions and supporting agile DevOps methods across multiple legacy coding environments. Continued investment in functionality that supports cloud and containerized app deployments, organizations improving application UI/UX and a shift to low- or no-code development concepts should provide continued growth opportunities within our Application Modernization business unit. The AMC business’s Host Connectivity and CORBA segments offer complementary modernization solutions enabling Rocket to provide a more comprehensive solution to our customers and increase our share in the application and development testing market.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: The market for our products and solutions is intensely competitive, subject to rapid change, and significantly affected by new product introductions and other market activities of industry participants. We face direct and indirect competition from a broad range of competitors who offer a variety of products and solutions to our current and potential customers. Competition among product providers in this market generally focuses on: - product features, functionality, performance and price; - cost containment; - ease of integration and speed of implementation; - company stability, resources and reputation; - level of customer service; and - new product and technology introductions. ----- We believe our primary competitive advantages in this market are our: - diversified base of long-standing customers; - innovative and effective research and development organization; - unique and differentiated partnership with IBM; - highly visible and predictable revenue model; - strong Free Cash Flow generation; and - experienced, founder-led management team. Our most frequently encountered competitors are BMC Software, Fortra and Broadcom. It is also possible that we will face competition from new industry participants or alternative technologies. Moreover, as the market for application infrastructure and tools, database tools suite, data management and analytics and storage and security develops, a number of companies with significantly greater resources than we have could attempt to enter or increase their presence in our industry, either independently or by acquiring or forming strategic alliances with our competitors, or otherwise increase their focus on the industry. In addition, current and potential competitors have established or may establish cooperative relationships among themselves or with third parties to increase the ability of their products to address the needs of our current and potential customers.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We believe that our future success depends in part on our ability to maintain and improve our core technologies, enhance our existing products, and develop new products that meet an expanding range of customer requirements. We have a differentiated research and development philosophy resulting in world-class revenue retention rates while leveraging a highly cost-efficient global platform. We have a team of 2,276 “Rocketeers,” of which approximately 63% are engineers. We go to market through dedicated enterprise sales, inside sales and renewals teams as well as channel partners. Our research and development model is based on the following key principles: - **_Customer-centric approach: customer pain points identified by sales and customer success teams drive product investments that will meet customers’ greatest needs. - **_Agile organization: proactively address new technology/customer trends, leveraging existing source code, moving from closed to open architectures and frameworks. - **_Strong partnership with IBM: deep insights into IBM’s mainframe roadmap and collaborative development opportunities ensure Rocket’s continued technical leadership. - **_Commitment and priority: approximately 63% of Rocketeers are software engineers who work in a highly collaborative culture which values teamwork, creativity and innovation.

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Our success depends in large part upon our proprietary technology. We attempt to protect our intellectual property rights primarily through a combination of patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, employee and third party nondisclosure agreements, and other measures. We believe that factors such as the technological and creative skills of our personnel, new product development, frequent product enhancements, name recognition, and reliable product ----- maintenance are essential to establishing and maintaining a technological leadership position. There can be no assurance that our means of protecting our intellectual property in the U.S. or abroad will be adequate. We seek to protect the source code of our proprietary software, any related documentation, and other written materials under trade secret and copyright laws, which afford only limited protection. Further, there can be no assurance that our patents will offer any protection or that they will not be challenged, invalidated, or circumvented. If we are unable to protect our intellectual property, or we infringe on the intellectual property rights of a third party, our operating results could be adversely affected. The trademarks and service marks identified in the following list are the properties of Rocket or our affiliates. These marks are registered with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office and may be registered or pending registration in other countries. Not all trademarks owned by Rocket/the Issuer are listed herein. The absence of a mark neither constitutes a waiver of any intellectual property rights that Rocket/the Issuer has established in its marks nor means that Rocket is not the owner of any such marks. In addition, we may possess certain common law rights in connection with other marks not listed below. - Accuterm - Aldon - Arkivio - BlueZone - Catalog Solution - Corbusiness - Corstrategy - Corvu - D3 - DIGITAL DISRUPTED - DOC-AID - DOCUMENTDIRECT - DR/XPERT - EOS - ESW

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Milan Shetti, President, Chief Executive Officer and member of Rocket’s board of directors, joined Rocket in 2020.
Subsubsection Text: Prior to joining Rocket, Mr. Shetti held various senior executive leadership positions at Hewlett Packard Enterprise from 2009 to 2020, both as a business leader and technologist. At HPE, Mr. Shetti was most recently the Senior Vice President and General Manager of the Storage and Big Data Business Unit and was previously Chief Technology Officer for HPE’s Datacenter Infrastructure group. Prior to HPE, Mr. Shetti served as Technology Board Advisor for Hedvig from 2017 to 2019. Mr. Shetti was the President and CEO of IBRIX Inc. from 2008 to 2009 prior to its acquisition by HPE. Mr. Shetti started his career at Sun Microsystems as a software developer in 2000, and advanced through a technical career path to Technical Director where he remained until 2006. Mr. Shetti holds a PhD in Computer Science at University of Minnesota and a Master of Science in Computer Engineering from Syracuse University.

Subsection Title: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS Management Agreement
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is party to a management agreement (the “Management Agreement”) with the Sponsor, pursuant to which the Issuer has retained the Sponsor to provide general executive, management, merger and consulting services, and other advisory services. The Management Agreement remains in effect until the earliest to occur of (i) termination by the Sponsor, (ii) the closing of an initial public offering of Issuer or its subsidiaries or (iii) a change of control of Issuer. A quarterly management fee of $0.5 million is payable to the Sponsor. Additionally, the Issuer provides customary exculpation and indemnification in favor of the Sponsor and its affiliates in connection with the services it provides. See Note 18, Transactions with Affiliates to our audited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this offering memorandum for further information. -----

Section Title: AMC BUSINESS’S MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: _The following management discussion and analysis of the AMC business’s financial condition and results of operations is intended to help readers understand the AMC business’s results of operations and financial condition, and should be read in conjunction with, the audited combined carveout financial statements and the accompanying notes to the audited combined carveout financial statements included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. All dollar and percentage comparisons made herein refer to the year ended December 31, 2023 compared with the year ended December 31, 2022, unless otherwise noted. Financial information presented in this management discussion and analysis of the AMC business’s financial condition and results of operations is presented in thousands of U.S. dollars, except for percentages or unless otherwise stated. Except as expressly noted, OpenText has not prepared or reviewed any information about the AMC business or the combined business for this offering memorandum or confirmed the accuracy of the information included in this offering memorandum._

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF OTHER INDEBTEDNESS
Subsubsection Text: On November 28, 2018, the Company entered into a credit facility with a syndicate of lenders that was amended by that certain (i) Amendment No. 1, dated as of February 2, 2021, (ii) Amendment No. 2 and Joinder Agreement, dated as of May 20, 2021, (iii) Amendment No. 3, dated as of June 28, 2021, (iv) Amendment No. 4, dated as of August 6, 2021, (v) Amendment No. 5 and Second Joinder Agreement, dated as of August 15, 2022, (vi) Amendment No. 6, dated as of December 22, 2022, (vii) Amendment No. 7, dated as of June 1, 2023, and (viii) Amendment No. 8, dated as of October 5, 2023. The Senior Secured Credit Facilities are comprised of the Existing First Lien Term Loans, which includes a first lien term loan consisting of the Existing Dollar Term Loan, an aggregate principal amount of approximately $1,410 million in U.S. dollar-denominated term loans, and the Existing Euro Term Loan, an aggregate principal amount of €575 million in Euro-denominated term loans (after giving effect to amortization payments made prior to the date hereof), each maturing on November 28, 2028, and the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility, a revolving loan facility in an aggregate principal amount of up to approximately $152.9 million maturing on November 28, 2026. On or around the date of issuance of the notes offered hereby, we intend to amend certain terms of the Senior Secured Credit Facilities to, among other things, (v) increase the aggregate principal amount of commitments under the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility by approximately $222 million to approximately $375 million, (w) extend the maturity date of certain of the revolving commitments under the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility from November 28, 2026 to August 29, 2028, (x) increase the applicable margin for adjusted SOFR to 4.00%, (y) increase the first lien net leverage ratio financial covenant to an amount not to exceed 8.00 to 1.00 and (z) add requirements for certain of our subsidiaries incorporated under the laws of England and Wales to guarantee and secure the obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities. On or around the date of issuance of the notes offered hereby, we intend to enter into the Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility under the credit agreement governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans and the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility, either as a side car term loan facility or as an incremental term loan facility under the credit agreement governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans, in a combined aggregate principal amount of $1,000 million (reflecting U.S. dollar-equivalent for the Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility), in each case with a syndicate of lenders, that will rank pari passu with the Existing First Lien Term Loans and which will mature on November 28, 2028. The documentation for our Senior Secured Credit Facilities provides that we have the right at any time, subject to customary conditions, to request incremental loans in an aggregate principal amount of up to (a) the greater of (1) $175 million and (2) an amount equal to 65% of our trailing twelve-month consolidated EBITDA at the time of determination on a pro forma basis, plus (b) an amount equal to all voluntary prepayments (including open market purchases) of the Existing First Lien Term Loans and certain other debt (to the extent not funded with the proceeds of long-term debt other than revolving loans), plus (c) an amount equal to all voluntary prepayments of any first lien refinancing facilities or certain other refinancing debt, plus (d) an additional amount so long as we (I) in the case of incremental debt that is secured by the collateral on a pari passu basis with our Senior Secured Credit Facilities, do not exceed a specified pro forma first lien net leverage ratio, (II) in the case of incremental debt that is secured by a lien on the collateral junior to the liens securing our Senior Secured Credit Facilities, do not exceed a specified pro forma secured net leverage ratio and (III) in the case of unsecured incremental debt or incremental debt secured solely by assets not constituting collateral, do not exceed a specified pro forma total net leverage ratio. The interest rate for the Existing Dollar Term Loan is or will be, as applicable, at the Company’s election: (i) 3.75%, plus “ABR” defined as the greatest of (a) the Federal Funds Effective Rate plus 0.50%, (b) the prime lending rate in effect on such day, and (c) Term SOFR applicable for an interest period of one month commencing on such day plus 1.0%; or (ii) 4.75% plus Term SOFR, which is subject to a 0.50% Term SOFR floor and Term SOFR adjustment. The interest rate for the Existing Euro Term Loan is: (i) 4.75%, plus “Adjusted EURIBOR Rate,” which is subject to a 0.00% floor. Interest payments are due either quarterly or on the last day of the applicable Interest Period for Term SOFR Loans and Adjusted EURIBOR Rate Loans, no less frequently than quarterly. Principal payments of 1% per ----- annum of the initial Existing First Lien Term Loans amounts are payable quarterly, with the remaining balance due at the maturity date for the Existing First Lien Term Loans on November 28, 2028. The interest rate for the Incremental First Lien Term Loan Facilities is expected to be Term SOFR, plus an applicable margin. The Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility interest rate is, at the Company’s election, (i) 2.25% plus ABR, or (ii) 3.25% plus SOFR with margin step-downs dependent on the Company’s first lien net leverage ratio as follows: (a) if the first lien net leverage ratio is between 4.50 to 1.00 and 4.00 to 1.00 the ABR and SOFR margins are 2.125% and 3.125%, respectively; and (b) if the first lien net leverage ratio is less than or equal to 4.00 to 1.00 the ABR and SOFR margins are 2.00% and 3.00%, respectively. The maturity date of the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility is November 28, 2026. The Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility’s capacity is reduced by the aggregated letters of credit outstanding, which totaled $1.2 million as of December 31, 2023. The Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain a financial covenant that applies solely with respect to the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility and requires a maximum first lien net leverage ratio of 7.70 to 1.00 if, on the last day of any quarter, the principal amount of revolving credit loans then outstanding under the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility is greater than 35% of the aggregate outstanding revolving credit commitments. The Senior Secured Credit Facilities are also subject to certain mandatory prepayment requirements, including, with respect to the Existing First Lien Term Loans, 50% (with step-downs to 25% and 0% based on achieving certain first lien net leverage ratios) of annual excess cash flow greater than $15 million in any fiscal year. The Senior Secured Credit Facilities also contain quarterly and annual financial reporting requirements. For further information, see _Note 10, Long-Term Debt to our audited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this offering memorandum.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF OTHER INDEBTEDNESS
Subsubsection Text: As of August 16, 2019, we assumed the RSD Debt in connection with the acquisition of Sixon Holding SA. Pursuant to the credit agreement governing the RSD Debt, dated September 19, 2018, the RSD Debt consists of a CHF 17.5 million senior amortizing term loan facility and a CHF 17.5 million senior non-amortizing (bullet) term loan facility. The amortizing term loan facility is subject to mandatory repayments of CHF 3.2 million, payable annually on December 31st through 2022, with a final payment of CHF 3.2 million due on March 28, 2024 (which payment was made). The non-amortizing term loan facility, which consists of U.S. dollar-denominated facilities and Eurodenominated facilities, has a maturity date of September 28, 2024. As of December 31, 2023, the outstanding amount, translated into U.S. dollars, under the RSD Debt was $19.7 million. For further information, see _Note 10,_ _Long-Term Debt to our audited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this offering memorandum.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF OTHER INDEBTEDNESS
Subsubsection Text: On February 2, 2021, we issued $575 million in aggregate principal amount of 6.500% Senior Notes due 2029, to persons reasonably believed to be “qualified institutional buyers” (as defined in Rule 144A under the Securities Act) and (b) outside the United States to non-U.S. persons in compliance with Regulation S under the Securities Act. The Existing Notes are jointly and severally unconditionally guaranteed on a senior unsecured basis by each of our wholly-owned subsidiaries that guarantee our obligations under certain credit facilities. The Existing Notes will mature on February 15, 2029. Interest on the Existing Notes accrues at a rate of 6.500% per annum and is payable semi-annually in arrears on February 15 and August 15 of each year. On or after February 15, 2024, we may redeem, in whole or in part, upon not less than 10 nor more than 60 days’ notice, at the redemption prices (expressed as a percentage of the principal amount) set forth below plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, on ----- the note redeemed, to, but excluding, the applicable redemption date, if redeemed during the twelve-month period beginning on February 15 of the year indicated below:

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF OTHER INDEBTEDNESS
Subsubsection Text: 2024.................................................................................................................................................. 103.250% 2025.................................................................................................................................................. 101.625% 2026 and thereafter............................................................................................................................ 100.000% The indenture governing the Existing Notes limits the ability of the Issuer and its restricted subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions, to incur additional indebtedness or guarantee indebtedness; declare or pay dividends, redeem stock or make other distributions to stockholders; make investments; create liens or use assets as security in other transactions; merge or consolidate, or sell, transfer, lease or dispose of substantially all of our assets; enter into transactions with affiliates; and sell or transfer certain assets. These covenants are subject to a number of important exceptions and qualifications. In addition, in certain circumstances, if the Issuer sells assets or experience certain changes of control, they must offer to purchase the Existing Notes at 101% of their principal amount plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any. -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF OTHER INDEBTEDNESS
Subsubsection Text: The following is a summary of certain provisions of the instruments evidencing our material indebtedness. This summary does not purport to be complete and is subject to, and is qualified in its entirety by reference to, all of the provisions of the agreements, including the definitions of certain terms therein that are not otherwise defined in this offering memorandum.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF NOTES
Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Notes and the Note Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: If the Issue Date occurs prior to the Acquisition Date, the Notes will be secured only by a first-priority security interest in the Escrow Account and all funds on deposit therein (as set forth under “—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption”). From and after the Completion Date, the Notes will be: - general senior secured obligations of the Company, secured on a first-priority basis by the Collateral, subject to certain Liens (as defined below) permitted under the Indenture; - _pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future senior Indebtedness (including Indebtedness under the Credit Agreements and the Existing Notes) of the Company; - _pari passu as to the Collateral owned by the Company with the Indebtedness under the Credit Agreements and all future Indebtedness of the Company secured by a first-priority Lien on the Collateral owned by the Company; ----- - effectively senior to all existing and future unsecured Indebtedness of the Company (including Indebtedness under the Existing Notes) and junior priority secured Indebtedness, to the extent of the value of the Collateral securing the Notes; - effectively subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness of the Company that is secured by Liens on assets that do not constitute a part of the Collateral to the extent of the value of such assets; - senior in right of payment to any future Subordinated Indebtedness of the Company; - unconditionally guaranteed on a senior secured basis, jointly and severally, by each Guarantor; and - structurally subordinated to any existing and future Indebtedness and other liabilities, including preferred stock, of Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries and any other Subsidiaries of the Company that are not Guarantors. If the Issue Date occurs prior to the Acquisition Date, the Notes will not be guaranteed. From and after the Completion Date, each Note Guarantee (as defined below) will be: - a general senior secured obligation of the applicable Guarantor, secured on a first-priority basis by the Collateral, subject to certain Liens permitted under the Indenture; - _pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior Indebtedness (including guarantees of Indebtedness under the Credit Agreements and the Existing Notes) of such Guarantor; - _pari passu as to the Collateral owned by such Guarantor with the Guarantee of such Guarantor under the Credit Agreements and all future Indebtedness of such Guarantor secured by a first-priority Lien on the Collateral owned by such Guarantor; - effectively senior to all existing and future unsecured Indebtedness of such Guarantor (including the Guarantee of Indebtedness under the Existing Notes) and junior priority secured Indebtedness, to the extent of the value of the Collateral securing the Notes; - effectively subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness of such Guarantor that is secured by Liens on assets that do not constitute a part of the Collateral to the extent of the value of such assets; - senior in right of payment to all future Subordinated Indebtedness of such Guarantor; and - structurally subordinated to all existing and future Indebtedness and other liabilities, including preferred stock, of any Subsidiaries of such Guarantor that are not Guarantors.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Company will issue Notes in minimum denominations of $2,000 and in integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof. The rights of Holders of beneficial interests in the Notes to receive the payments on such Notes are subject to applicable procedures of DTC. If the due date for any payment in respect of any Notes is not a Business Day at the place at which such payment is due to be paid, the Holder thereof will not be entitled to payment of the amount due until the next succeeding Business Day at such place, and will not be entitled to any further interest or other payment as a result of any such delay. The Company will issue an aggregate principal amount of $1,000,000,000 of Notes on the Issue Date. The Notes will mature on November 28, 2028. Interest on the Notes will accrue at the rate of      % per annum and will be payable, in cash, semi-annually in arrears on         and         of each year, commencing on        , 2024, to Holders of record on the immediately preceding         and        , respectively. Interest on the Notes will accrue from the most recent date to which interest has been paid or, if no interest has been paid, from the date of original issuance. ----- If the Company delivers global notes to the Trustee for cancellation on a date that is after the record date and on or before the corresponding interest payment date, then interest shall be paid in accordance with the applicable procedures of DTC. Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year comprised of twelve 30-day months. Each interest period will end on (but not include) the relevant interest payment date.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Company may issue additional Notes (the “Additional Notes”) from time to time under the Indenture. The Indenture will provide for the issuance of Additional Notes having identical terms and conditions to the Notes offered hereby, subject to compliance with the covenants contained in the Indenture. It is intended, to the maximum extent possible, that any such Additional Notes will be part of the same issue as the Notes offered hereby under the Indenture for all purposes, including waivers, amendments, redemptions and offers to purchase; provided that Additional Notes will not be issued with the same CUSIP as the Notes offered hereby unless such Additional Notes are part of the same issue as the Notes offered hereby for U.S. federal income Tax purposes. Any issuance of Additional Notes will be subject to the covenant described under the caption “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Indebtedness.”

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Principal of, and premium, if any, and interest on the Notes will be payable at the office or agency of the Company maintained for such purpose (along with any other paying agent maintained by the Company, the “Paying Agent”) or, at the option of the Paying Agent, payment of interest, if any, may be made by check mailed to the Holders at their respective addresses set forth in the register of Holders or by wire transfer of immediately available funds to the accounts specified by the Holders; provided that all payments of principal, premium, if any, and interest with respect to Notes represented by one or more global notes registered in the name of or held by DTC or its nominee will be made by wire transfer of immediately available funds to the accounts specified by the Holders thereof. Until otherwise designated by the Company, the Company’s office or agency maintained for such purpose will be the office of the Trustee.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF NOTES
